       1                 :            : /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
       2                 :            :  *
       3                 :            :  * heapam.c
       4                 :            :  *    heap access method code
       5                 :            :  *
       6                 :            :  * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2019, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
       7                 :            :  * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California
       8                 :            :  *
       9                 :            :  *
      10                 :            :  * IDENTIFICATION
      11                 :            :  *    src/backend/access/heap/heapam.c
      12                 :            :  *
      13                 :            :  *
      14                 :            :  * INTERFACE ROUTINES
      15                 :            :  *      heap_beginscan  - begin relation scan
      16                 :            :  *      heap_rescan     - restart a relation scan
      17                 :            :  *      heap_endscan    - end relation scan
      18                 :            :  *      heap_getnext    - retrieve next tuple in scan
      19                 :            :  *      heap_fetch      - retrieve tuple with given tid
      20                 :            :  *      heap_insert     - insert tuple into a relation
      21                 :            :  *      heap_multi_insert - insert multiple tuples into a relation
      22                 :            :  *      heap_delete     - delete a tuple from a relation
      23                 :            :  *      heap_update     - replace a tuple in a relation with another tuple
      24                 :            :  *      heap_sync       - sync heap, for when no WAL has been written
      25                 :            :  *
      26                 :            :  * NOTES
      27                 :            :  *    This file contains the heap_ routines which implement
      28                 :            :  *    the POSTGRES heap access method used for all POSTGRES
      29                 :            :  *    relations.
      30                 :            :  *
      31                 :            :  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------
      32                 :            :  */

     105                 :            : static HeapTuple ExtractReplicaIdentity(Relation rel, HeapTuple tup, bool key_modified,
     106                 :            :                                         bool *copy);
     107                 :            : 
     108                 :            : 
     109                 :            : /*
     110                 :            :  * Each tuple lock mode has a corresponding heavyweight lock, and one or two
     111                 :            :  * corresponding MultiXactStatuses (one to merely lock tuples, another one to
     112                 :            :  * update them).  This table (and the macros below) helps us determine the
     113                 :            :  * heavyweight lock mode and MultiXactStatus values to use for any particular
     114                 :            :  * tuple lock strength.
     115                 :            :  *
     116                 :            :  * Don't look at lockstatus/updstatus directly!  Use get_mxact_status_for_lock
     117                 :            :  * instead.
     118                 :            :  */
     119                 :            : static const struct
     120                 :            : {
     121                 :            :     LOCKMODE    hwlock;
     122                 :            :     int         lockstatus;
     123                 :            :     int         updstatus;
     124                 :            : }
     125                 :            : 
     126                 :            :             tupleLockExtraInfo[MaxLockTupleMode + 1] =
     127                 :            : {
     128                 :            :     {                           /* LockTupleKeyShare */
     129                 :            :         AccessShareLock,
     130                 :            :         MultiXactStatusForKeyShare,
     131                 :            :         -1                      /* KeyShare does not allow updating tuples */
     132                 :            :     },
     133                 :            :     {                           /* LockTupleShare */
     134                 :            :         RowShareLock,
     135                 :            :         MultiXactStatusForShare,
     136                 :            :         -1                      /* Share does not allow updating tuples */
     137                 :            :     },
     138                 :            :     {                           /* LockTupleNoKeyExclusive */
     139                 :            :         ExclusiveLock,
     140                 :            :         MultiXactStatusForNoKeyUpdate,
     141                 :            :         MultiXactStatusNoKeyUpdate
     142                 :            :     },
     143                 :            :     {                           /* LockTupleExclusive */
     144                 :            :         AccessExclusiveLock,
     145                 :            :         MultiXactStatusForUpdate,
     146                 :            :         MultiXactStatusUpdate
     147                 :            :     }
     148                 :            : };
     149                 :            : 
     150                 :            : /* Get the LOCKMODE for a given MultiXactStatus */
     151                 :            : #define LOCKMODE_from_mxstatus(status) \
     152                 :            :             (tupleLockExtraInfo[TUPLOCK_from_mxstatus((status))].hwlock)
     153                 :            : 
     154                 :            : /*
     155                 :            :  * Acquire heavyweight locks on tuples, using a LockTupleMode strength value.
     156                 :            :  * This is more readable than having every caller translate it to lock.h's
     157                 :            :  * LOCKMODE.
     158                 :            :  */
     159                 :            : #define LockTupleTuplock(rel, tup, mode) \
     160                 :            :     LockTuple((rel), (tup), tupleLockExtraInfo[mode].hwlock)
     161                 :            : #define UnlockTupleTuplock(rel, tup, mode) \
     162                 :            :     UnlockTuple((rel), (tup), tupleLockExtraInfo[mode].hwlock)
     163                 :            : #define ConditionalLockTupleTuplock(rel, tup, mode) \
     164                 :            :     ConditionalLockTuple((rel), (tup), tupleLockExtraInfo[mode].hwlock)
     165                 :            : 
     166                 :            : #ifdef USE_PREFETCH
     167                 :            : /*
     168                 :            :  * heap_compute_xid_horizon_for_tuples and xid_horizon_prefetch_buffer use
     169                 :            :  * this structure to coordinate prefetching activity.
     170                 :            :  */
     171                 :            : typedef struct
     172                 :            : {
     173                 :            :     BlockNumber cur_hblkno;
     174                 :            :     int         next_item;
     175                 :            :     int         nitems;
     176                 :            :     ItemPointerData *tids;
     177                 :            : } XidHorizonPrefetchState;
     178                 :            : #endif
     179                 :            : 
     180                 :            : /*
     181                 :            :  * This table maps tuple lock strength values for each particular
     182                 :            :  * MultiXactStatus value.
     183                 :            :  */
     184                 :            : static const int MultiXactStatusLock[MaxMultiXactStatus + 1] =
     185                 :            : {
     186                 :            :     LockTupleKeyShare,          /* ForKeyShare */
     187                 :            :     LockTupleShare,             /* ForShare */
     188                 :            :     LockTupleNoKeyExclusive,    /* ForNoKeyUpdate */
     189                 :            :     LockTupleExclusive,         /* ForUpdate */
     190                 :            :     LockTupleNoKeyExclusive,    /* NoKeyUpdate */
     191                 :            :     LockTupleExclusive          /* Update */
     192                 :            : };
     193                 :            : 
     194                 :            : /* Get the LockTupleMode for a given MultiXactStatus */
     195                 :            : #define TUPLOCK_from_mxstatus(status) \
     196                 :            :             (MultiXactStatusLock[(status)])

     211                 :            :     bool        allow_strat;

     213                 :            : 
     214                 :            :     /*
     215                 :            :      * Determine the number of blocks we have to scan.
     216                 :            :      *
     217                 :            :      * It is sufficient to do this once at scan start, since any tuples added
     218                 :            :      * while the scan is in progress will be invisible to my snapshot anyway.
     219                 :            :      * (That is not true when using a non-MVCC snapshot.  However, we couldn't
     220                 :            :      * guarantee to return tuples added after scan start anyway, since they
     221                 :            :      * might go into pages we already scanned.  To guarantee consistent
     222                 :            :      * results for a non-MVCC snapshot, the caller must hold some higher-level
     223                 :            :      * lock that ensures the interesting tuple(s) won't change.)
     224                 :            :      */
     225         [ +  + ]:    2760818 :     if (scan->rs_base.rs_parallel != NULL)

     231                 :    2760676 :         scan->rs_nblocks = RelationGetNumberOfBlocks(scan->rs_base.rs_rd);
     232                 :            : 
     233                 :            :     /*
     234                 :            :      * If the table is large relative to NBuffers, use a bulk-read access
     235                 :            :      * strategy and enable synchronized scanning (see syncscan.c).  Although
     236                 :            :      * the thresholds for these features could be different, we make them the
     237                 :            :      * same so that there are only two behaviors to tune rather than four.
     238                 :            :      * (However, some callers need to be able to disable one or both of these
     239                 :            :      * behaviors, independently of the size of the table; also there is a GUC
     240                 :            :      * variable that can disable synchronized scanning.)
     241                 :            :      *
     242                 :            :      * Note that table_block_parallelscan_initialize has a very similar test;

     343                 :            : 
     344                 :            : /*
     345                 :            :  * heapgetpage - subroutine for heapgettup()
     346                 :            :  *
     347                 :            :  * This routine reads and pins the specified page of the relation.
     348                 :            :  * In page-at-a-time mode it performs additional work, namely determining
     349                 :            :  * which tuples on the page are visible.
     350                 :            :  */
     351                 :            : void
     352                 :   78504684 : heapgetpage(TableScanDesc sscan, BlockNumber page)
     353                 :            : {
     354                 :   78504684 :     HeapScanDesc scan = (HeapScanDesc) sscan;
     355                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
     356                 :            :     Snapshot    snapshot;
     357                 :            :     Page        dp;
     358                 :            :     int         lines;
     359                 :            :     int         ntup;
     360                 :            :     OffsetNumber lineoff;
     361                 :            :     ItemId      lpp;
     362                 :            :     bool        all_visible;
     363                 :            : 
     364                 :            :     Assert(page < scan->rs_nblocks);
     365                 :            : 
     366                 :            :     /* release previous scan buffer, if any */
     367         [ +  + ]:   78504684 :     if (BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf))
     368                 :            :     {
     369                 :   75828929 :         ReleaseBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf);
     370                 :   75828929 :         scan->rs_cbuf = InvalidBuffer;
     371                 :            :     }
     372                 :            : 
     373                 :            :     /*
     374                 :            :      * Be sure to check for interrupts at least once per page.  Checks at
     375                 :            :      * higher code levels won't be able to stop a seqscan that encounters many
     376                 :            :      * pages' worth of consecutive dead tuples.
     377                 :            :      */
     378         [ +  + ]:   78504684 :     CHECK_FOR_INTERRUPTS();
     379                 :            : 
     380                 :            :     /* read page using selected strategy */
     381                 :   78504684 :     scan->rs_cbuf = ReadBufferExtended(scan->rs_base.rs_rd, MAIN_FORKNUM, page,
     382                 :            :                                        RBM_NORMAL, scan->rs_strategy);
     383                 :   78504684 :     scan->rs_cblock = page;
     384                 :            : 
     385         [ -  + ]:   78504684 :     if (!(scan->rs_base.rs_flags & SO_ALLOW_PAGEMODE))
     386                 :          0 :         return;
     387                 :            : 
     388                 :   78504684 :     buffer = scan->rs_cbuf;
     389                 :   78504684 :     snapshot = scan->rs_base.rs_snapshot;
     390                 :            : 
     391                 :            :     /*
     392                 :            :      * Prune and repair fragmentation for the whole page, if possible.
     393                 :            :      */
     394                 :   78504684 :     heap_page_prune_opt(scan->rs_base.rs_rd, buffer);
     395                 :            : 
     396                 :            :     /*
     397                 :            :      * We must hold share lock on the buffer content while examining tuple
     398                 :            :      * visibility.  Afterwards, however, the tuples we have found to be
     399                 :            :      * visible are guaranteed good as long as we hold the buffer pin.
     400                 :            :      */
     401                 :   78504684 :     LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
     402                 :            : 
     403         [ -  + ]:   78504684 :     dp = BufferGetPage(buffer);
     404                 :   78504684 :     TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, scan->rs_base.rs_rd, dp);
     405         [ +  + ]:   78503197 :     lines = PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(dp);
     406                 :   78503197 :     ntup = 0;
     407                 :            : 
     408                 :            :     /*
     409                 :            :      * If the all-visible flag indicates that all tuples on the page are
     410                 :            :      * visible to everyone, we can skip the per-tuple visibility tests.
     411                 :            :      *
     412                 :            :      * Note: In hot standby, a tuple that's already visible to all
     413                 :            :      * transactions in the master might still be invisible to a read-only
     414                 :            :      * transaction in the standby. We partly handle this problem by tracking
     415                 :            :      * the minimum xmin of visible tuples as the cut-off XID while marking a
     416                 :            :      * page all-visible on master and WAL log that along with the visibility
     417                 :            :      * map SET operation. In hot standby, we wait for (or abort) all
     418                 :            :      * transactions that can potentially may not see one or more tuples on the
     419                 :            :      * page. That's how index-only scans work fine in hot standby. A crucial
     420                 :            :      * difference between index-only scans and heap scans is that the
     421                 :            :      * index-only scan completely relies on the visibility map where as heap
     422                 :            :      * scan looks at the page-level PD_ALL_VISIBLE flag. We are not sure if
     423                 :            :      * the page-level flag can be trusted in the same way, because it might
     424                 :            :      * get propagated somehow without being explicitly WAL-logged, e.g. via a
     425                 :            :      * full page write. Until we can prove that beyond doubt, let's check each
     426                 :            :      * tuple for visibility the hard way.
     427                 :            :      */
     428 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:   78503197 :     all_visible = PageIsAllVisible(dp) && !snapshot->takenDuringRecovery;
     429                 :            : 
     430         [ +  + ]: 1150113248 :     for (lineoff = FirstOffsetNumber, lpp = PageGetItemId(dp, lineoff);
     431                 : 1150113248 :          lineoff <= lines;
     432                 : 1071610051 :          lineoff++, lpp++)
     433                 :            :     {
     434         [ +  + ]: 1071641244 :         if (ItemIdIsNormal(lpp))
     435                 :            :         {
     436                 :            :             HeapTupleData loctup;
     437                 :            :             bool        valid;
     438                 :            : 
     439                 :  783582033 :             loctup.t_tableOid = RelationGetRelid(scan->rs_base.rs_rd);
     440                 :  783582033 :             loctup.t_data = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem((Page) dp, lpp);
     441                 :  783582033 :             loctup.t_len = ItemIdGetLength(lpp);
     442                 :  783582033 :             ItemPointerSet(&(loctup.t_self), page, lineoff);
     443                 :            : 
     444         [ +  + ]:  783582033 :             if (all_visible)
     445                 :   14757367 :                 valid = true;
     446                 :            :             else
     447                 :  768824666 :                 valid = HeapTupleSatisfiesVisibility(&loctup, snapshot, buffer);
     448                 :            : 
     449                 :  783582033 :             CheckForSerializableConflictOut(valid, scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     450                 :            :                                             &loctup, buffer, snapshot);
     451                 :            : 
     452         [ +  + ]:  783550840 :             if (valid)
     453                 :  783550840 :                 scan->rs_vistuples[ntup++] = lineoff;
     454                 :            :         }
     455                 :            :     }
     456                 :            : 
     457                 :   78472004 :     LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
     458                 :            : 
     459                 :            :     Assert(ntup <= MaxHeapTuplesPerPage);
     460                 :   78472004 :     scan->rs_ntuples = ntup;
     461                 :            : }
     462                 :            : 
     463                 :            : /* ----------------
     464                 :            :  *      heapgettup - fetch next heap tuple
     465                 :            :  *
     466                 :            :  *      Initialize the scan if not already done; then advance to the next
     467                 :            :  *      tuple as indicated by "dir"; return the next tuple in scan->rs_ctup,
     468                 :            :  *      or set scan->rs_ctup.t_data = NULL if no more tuples.
     469                 :            :  *
     470                 :            :  * dir == NoMovementScanDirection means "re-fetch the tuple indicated
     471                 :            :  * by scan->rs_ctup".
     472                 :            :  *
     473                 :            :  * Note: the reason nkeys/key are passed separately, even though they are
     474                 :            :  * kept in the scan descriptor, is that the caller may not want us to check
     475                 :            :  * the scankeys.
     476                 :            :  *
     477                 :            :  * Note: when we fall off the end of the scan in either direction, we
     478                 :            :  * reset rs_inited.  This means that a further request with the same
     479                 :            :  * scan direction will restart the scan, which is a bit odd, but a
     480                 :            :  * request with the opposite scan direction will start a fresh scan
     481                 :            :  * in the proper direction.  The latter is required behavior for cursors,
     482                 :            :  * while the former case is generally undefined behavior in Postgres
     483                 :            :  * so we don't care too much.
     484                 :            :  * ----------------
     485                 :            :  */
     486                 :            : static void
     487                 :       4743 : heapgettup(HeapScanDesc scan,
     488                 :            :            ScanDirection dir,
     489                 :            :            int nkeys,
     490                 :            :            ScanKey key)
     491                 :            : {
     492                 :       4743 :     HeapTuple   tuple = &(scan->rs_ctup);
     493                 :       4743 :     Snapshot    snapshot = scan->rs_base.rs_snapshot;
     494                 :       4743 :     bool        backward = ScanDirectionIsBackward(dir);
     495                 :            :     BlockNumber page;
     496                 :            :     bool        finished;
     497                 :            :     Page        dp;
     498                 :            :     int         lines;
     499                 :            :     OffsetNumber lineoff;
     500                 :            :     int         linesleft;
     501                 :            :     ItemId      lpp;
     502                 :            : 
     503                 :            :     /*
     504                 :            :      * calculate next starting lineoff, given scan direction
     505                 :            :      */
     506         [ +  - ]:       4743 :     if (ScanDirectionIsForward(dir))
     507                 :            :     {
     508         [ +  - ]:       4743 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     509                 :            :         {
     510                 :            :             /*
     511                 :            :              * return null immediately if relation is empty
     512                 :            :              */
     513 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:       4743 :             if (scan->rs_nblocks == 0 || scan->rs_numblocks == 0)
     514                 :            :             {
     515                 :            :                 Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     516                 :       4743 :                 tuple->t_data = NULL;
     517                 :       4743 :                 return;
     518                 :            :             }
     519         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (scan->rs_base.rs_parallel != NULL)
     520                 :            :             {
     521                 :          0 :                 ParallelBlockTableScanDesc pbscan =
     522                 :            :                 (ParallelBlockTableScanDesc) scan->rs_base.rs_parallel;
     523                 :            : 
     524                 :          0 :                 table_block_parallelscan_startblock_init(scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     525                 :            :                                                          pbscan);
     526                 :            : 
     527                 :          0 :                 page = table_block_parallelscan_nextpage(scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     528                 :            :                                                          pbscan);
     529                 :            : 
     530                 :            :                 /* Other processes might have already finished the scan. */
     531         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (page == InvalidBlockNumber)
     532                 :            :                 {
     533                 :            :                     Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     534                 :          0 :                     tuple->t_data = NULL;
     535                 :          0 :                     return;
     536                 :            :                 }
     537                 :            :             }
     538                 :            :             else
     539                 :          0 :                 page = scan->rs_startblock; /* first page */
     540                 :          0 :             heapgetpage((TableScanDesc) scan, page);
     541                 :          0 :             lineoff = FirstOffsetNumber;    /* first offnum */
     542                 :          0 :             scan->rs_inited = true;
     543                 :            :         }
     544                 :            :         else
     545                 :            :         {
     546                 :            :             /* continue from previously returned page/tuple */
     547                 :          0 :             page = scan->rs_cblock; /* current page */
     548                 :          0 :             lineoff =           /* next offnum */
     549                 :          0 :                 OffsetNumberNext(ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&(tuple->t_self)));
     550                 :            :         }
     551                 :            : 
     552                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
     553                 :            : 
     554         [ #  # ]:          0 :         dp = BufferGetPage(scan->rs_cbuf);
     555                 :          0 :         TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, scan->rs_base.rs_rd, dp);
     556         [ #  # ]:          0 :         lines = PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(dp);
     557                 :            :         /* page and lineoff now reference the physically next tid */
     558                 :            : 
     559                 :          0 :         linesleft = lines - lineoff + 1;
     560                 :            :     }
     561         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (backward)
     562                 :            :     {
     563                 :            :         /* backward parallel scan not supported */
     564                 :            :         Assert(scan->rs_base.rs_parallel == NULL);
     565                 :            : 
     566         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     567                 :            :         {
     568                 :            :             /*
     569                 :            :              * return null immediately if relation is empty
     570                 :            :              */
     571 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             if (scan->rs_nblocks == 0 || scan->rs_numblocks == 0)
     572                 :            :             {
     573                 :            :                 Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     574                 :          0 :                 tuple->t_data = NULL;
     575                 :          0 :                 return;
     576                 :            :             }
     577                 :            : 
     578                 :            :             /*
     579                 :            :              * Disable reporting to syncscan logic in a backwards scan; it's
     580                 :            :              * not very likely anyone else is doing the same thing at the same
     581                 :            :              * time, and much more likely that we'll just bollix things for
     582                 :            :              * forward scanners.
     583                 :            :              */
     584                 :          0 :             scan->rs_base.rs_flags &= ~SO_ALLOW_SYNC;
     585                 :            : 
     586                 :            :             /*
     587                 :            :              * Start from last page of the scan.  Ensure we take into account
     588                 :            :              * rs_numblocks if it's been adjusted by heap_setscanlimits().
     589                 :            :              */

     591                 :          0 :                 page = (scan->rs_startblock + scan->rs_numblocks - 1) % scan->rs_nblocks;

     593                 :          0 :                 page = scan->rs_startblock - 1;
     594                 :            :             else
     595                 :          0 :                 page = scan->rs_nblocks - 1;

     597                 :            :         }
     598                 :            :         else
     599                 :            :         {
     600                 :            :             /* continue from previously returned page/tuple */
     601                 :          0 :             page = scan->rs_cblock; /* current page */
     602                 :            :         }
     603                 :            : 
     604                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
     605                 :            : 
     606         [ #  # ]:          0 :         dp = BufferGetPage(scan->rs_cbuf);
     607                 :          0 :         TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, scan->rs_base.rs_rd, dp);
     608         [ #  # ]:          0 :         lines = PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(dp);
     609                 :            : 
     610         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     611                 :            :         {
     612                 :          0 :             lineoff = lines;    /* final offnum */
     613                 :          0 :             scan->rs_inited = true;
     614                 :            :         }
     615                 :            :         else
     616                 :            :         {
     617                 :          0 :             lineoff =           /* previous offnum */
     618                 :          0 :                 OffsetNumberPrev(ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&(tuple->t_self)));
     619                 :            :         }
     620                 :            :         /* page and lineoff now reference the physically previous tid */
     621                 :            : 
     622                 :          0 :         linesleft = lineoff;
     623                 :            :     }
     624                 :            :     else
     625                 :            :     {
     626                 :            :         /*
     627                 :            :          * ``no movement'' scan direction: refetch prior tuple
     628                 :            :          */
     629         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     630                 :            :         {

     632                 :          0 :             tuple->t_data = NULL;
     633                 :          0 :             return;
     634                 :            :         }
     635                 :            : 
     636                 :          0 :         page = ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(&(tuple->t_self));

     639                 :            : 
     640                 :            :         /* Since the tuple was previously fetched, needn't lock page here */
     641         [ #  # ]:          0 :         dp = BufferGetPage(scan->rs_cbuf);

     643                 :          0 :         lineoff = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&(tuple->t_self));
     644                 :          0 :         lpp = PageGetItemId(dp, lineoff);
     645                 :            :         Assert(ItemIdIsNormal(lpp));

     648                 :          0 :         tuple->t_len = ItemIdGetLength(lpp);
     649                 :            : 
     650                 :          0 :         return;
     651                 :            :     }
     652                 :            : 
     653                 :            :     /*
     654                 :            :      * advance the scan until we find a qualifying tuple or run out of stuff
     655                 :            :      * to scan
     656                 :            :      */

     658                 :            :     for (;;)
     659                 :            :     {
     660         [ #  # ]:          0 :         while (linesleft > 0)

     674                 :            :                                                      snapshot,
     675                 :            :                                                      scan->rs_cbuf);

     681 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (valid && key != NULL)
     682 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                     HeapKeyTest(tuple, RelationGetDescr(scan->rs_base.rs_rd),

         [ #  # ][ #  # ]

         [ #  # ][ #  # ]

     684                 :            : 
     685         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (valid)
     686                 :            :                 {
     687                 :          0 :                     LockBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
     688                 :          0 :                     return;
     689                 :            :                 }
     690                 :            :             }
     691                 :            : 
     692                 :            :             /*
     693                 :            :              * otherwise move to the next item on the page
     694                 :            :              */
     695                 :          0 :             --linesleft;
     696         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (backward)
     697                 :            :             {
     698                 :          0 :                 --lpp;          /* move back in this page's ItemId array */
     699                 :          0 :                 --lineoff;
     700                 :            :             }
     701                 :            :             else
     702                 :            :             {
     703                 :          0 :                 ++lpp;          /* move forward in this page's ItemId array */
     704                 :          0 :                 ++lineoff;
     705                 :            :             }
     706                 :            :         }
     707                 :            : 
     708                 :            :         /*
     709                 :            :          * if we get here, it means we've exhausted the items on this page and
     710                 :            :          * it's time to move to the next.
     711                 :            :          */
     712                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
     713                 :            : 
     714                 :            :         /*
     715                 :            :          * advance to next/prior page and detect end of scan
     716                 :            :          */

     718                 :            :         {
     719 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             finished = (page == scan->rs_startblock) ||
                 [ #  # ]
     720                 :          0 :                 (scan->rs_numblocks != InvalidBlockNumber ? --scan->rs_numblocks == 0 : false);
     721         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (page == 0)
     722                 :          0 :                 page = scan->rs_nblocks;
     723                 :          0 :             page--;
     724                 :            :         }
     725         [ #  # ]:          0 :         else if (scan->rs_base.rs_parallel != NULL)
     726                 :            :         {
     727                 :          0 :             ParallelBlockTableScanDesc pbscan =
     728                 :            :             (ParallelBlockTableScanDesc) scan->rs_base.rs_parallel;
     729                 :            : 
     730                 :          0 :             page = table_block_parallelscan_nextpage(scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     731                 :            :                                                      pbscan);
     732                 :          0 :             finished = (page == InvalidBlockNumber);
     733                 :            :         }
     734                 :            :         else
     735                 :            :         {
     736                 :          0 :             page++;
     737         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (page >= scan->rs_nblocks)
     738                 :          0 :                 page = 0;
     739 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             finished = (page == scan->rs_startblock) ||
                 [ #  # ]
     740                 :          0 :                 (scan->rs_numblocks != InvalidBlockNumber ? --scan->rs_numblocks == 0 : false);
     741                 :            : 
     742                 :            :             /*
     743                 :            :              * Report our new scan position for synchronization purposes. We
     744                 :            :              * don't do that when moving backwards, however. That would just
     745                 :            :              * mess up any other forward-moving scanners.
     746                 :            :              *
     747                 :            :              * Note: we do this before checking for end of scan so that the
     748                 :            :              * final state of the position hint is back at the start of the
     749                 :            :              * rel.  That's not strictly necessary, but otherwise when you run
     750                 :            :              * the same query multiple times the starting position would shift
     751                 :            :              * a little bit backwards on every invocation, which is confusing.
     752                 :            :              * We don't guarantee any specific ordering in general, though.
     753                 :            :              */
     754         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (scan->rs_base.rs_flags & SO_ALLOW_SYNC)
     755                 :          0 :                 ss_report_location(scan->rs_base.rs_rd, page);
     756                 :            :         }
     757                 :            : 
     758                 :            :         /*
     759                 :            :          * return NULL if we've exhausted all the pages
     760                 :            :          */

     762                 :            :         {
     763         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf))
     764                 :          0 :                 ReleaseBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf);
     765                 :          0 :             scan->rs_cbuf = InvalidBuffer;
     766                 :          0 :             scan->rs_cblock = InvalidBlockNumber;
     767                 :          0 :             tuple->t_data = NULL;
     768                 :          0 :             scan->rs_inited = false;
     769                 :          0 :             return;
     770                 :            :         }
     771                 :            : 
     772                 :          0 :         heapgetpage((TableScanDesc) scan, page);
     773                 :            : 
     774                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(scan->rs_cbuf, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
     775                 :            : 
     776         [ #  # ]:          0 :         dp = BufferGetPage(scan->rs_cbuf);
     777                 :          0 :         TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, scan->rs_base.rs_rd, dp);
     778         [ #  # ]:          0 :         lines = PageGetMaxOffsetNumber((Page) dp);
     779                 :          0 :         linesleft = lines;
     780         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (backward)
     781                 :            :         {
     782                 :          0 :             lineoff = lines;
     783                 :          0 :             lpp = PageGetItemId(dp, lines);
     784                 :            :         }
     785                 :            :         else
     786                 :            :         {
     787                 :          0 :             lineoff = FirstOffsetNumber;
     788                 :          0 :             lpp = PageGetItemId(dp, FirstOffsetNumber);
     789                 :            :         }
     790                 :          0 :     }
     791                 :            : }
     792                 :            : 
     793                 :            : /* ----------------
     794                 :            :  *      heapgettup_pagemode - fetch next heap tuple in page-at-a-time mode
     795                 :            :  *
     796                 :            :  *      Same API as heapgettup, but used in page-at-a-time mode
     797                 :            :  *
     798                 :            :  * The internal logic is much the same as heapgettup's too, but there are some
     799                 :            :  * differences: we do not take the buffer content lock (that only needs to
     800                 :            :  * happen inside heapgetpage), and we iterate through just the tuples listed
     801                 :            :  * in rs_vistuples[] rather than all tuples on the page.  Notice that
     802                 :            :  * lineindex is 0-based, where the corresponding loop variable lineoff in
     803                 :            :  * heapgettup is 1-based.
     804                 :            :  * ----------------
     805                 :            :  */
     806                 :            : static void
     807                 :  546282878 : heapgettup_pagemode(HeapScanDesc scan,
     808                 :            :                     ScanDirection dir,
     809                 :            :                     int nkeys,
     810                 :            :                     ScanKey key)
     811                 :            : {
     812                 :  546282878 :     HeapTuple   tuple = &(scan->rs_ctup);
     813                 :  546282878 :     bool        backward = ScanDirectionIsBackward(dir);
     814                 :            :     BlockNumber page;
     815                 :            :     bool        finished;
     816                 :            :     Page        dp;
     817                 :            :     int         lines;
     818                 :            :     int         lineindex;
     819                 :            :     OffsetNumber lineoff;
     820                 :            :     int         linesleft;
     821                 :            :     ItemId      lpp;
     822                 :            : 
     823                 :            :     /*
     824                 :            :      * calculate next starting lineindex, given scan direction
     825                 :            :      */
     826         [ +  - ]:  546282878 :     if (ScanDirectionIsForward(dir))
     827                 :            :     {
     828         [ +  + ]:  546282878 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     829                 :            :         {
     830                 :            :             /*
     831                 :            :              * return null immediately if relation is empty
     832                 :            :              */
     833 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:    2676758 :             if (scan->rs_nblocks == 0 || scan->rs_numblocks == 0)
     834                 :            :             {
     835                 :            :                 Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     836                 :       1003 :                 tuple->t_data = NULL;
     837                 :       1003 :                 return;
     838                 :            :             }
     839         [ +  + ]:    2675755 :             if (scan->rs_base.rs_parallel != NULL)
     840                 :            :             {
     841                 :        142 :                 ParallelBlockTableScanDesc pbscan =
     842                 :            :                 (ParallelBlockTableScanDesc) scan->rs_base.rs_parallel;
     843                 :            : 
     844                 :        142 :                 table_block_parallelscan_startblock_init(scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     845                 :            :                                                          pbscan);
     846                 :            : 
     847                 :        142 :                 page = table_block_parallelscan_nextpage(scan->rs_base.rs_rd,
     848                 :            :                                                          pbscan);
     849                 :            : 
     850                 :            :                 /* Other processes might have already finished the scan. */
     851         [ -  + ]:        142 :                 if (page == InvalidBlockNumber)
     852                 :            :                 {
     853                 :            :                     Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     854                 :          0 :                     tuple->t_data = NULL;
     855                 :        142 :                     return;
     856                 :            :                 }
     857                 :            :             }
     858                 :            :             else
     859                 :    2675613 :                 page = scan->rs_startblock; /* first page */
     860                 :    2675755 :             heapgetpage((TableScanDesc) scan, page);
     861                 :    2664900 :             lineindex = 0;
     862                 :    2664900 :             scan->rs_inited = true;
     863                 :            :         }
     864                 :            :         else
     865                 :            :         {
     866                 :            :             /* continue from previously returned page/tuple */
     867                 :  543606120 :             page = scan->rs_cblock; /* current page */
     868                 :  543606120 :             lineindex = scan->rs_cindex + 1;
     869                 :            :         }
     870                 :            : 
     871         [ -  + ]:  546271020 :         dp = BufferGetPage(scan->rs_cbuf);
     872                 :  546271020 :         TestForOldSnapshot(scan->rs_base.rs_snapshot, scan->rs_base.rs_rd, dp);
     873                 :  546269628 :         lines = scan->rs_ntuples;
     874                 :            :         /* page and lineindex now reference the next visible tid */
     875                 :            : 
     876                 :  546269628 :         linesleft = lines - lineindex;
     877                 :            :     }
     878         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (backward)
     879                 :            :     {
     880                 :            :         /* backward parallel scan not supported */
     881                 :            :         Assert(scan->rs_base.rs_parallel == NULL);
     882                 :            : 
     883         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!scan->rs_inited)
     884                 :            :         {
     885                 :            :             /*
     886                 :            :              * return null immediately if relation is empty
     887                 :            :              */
     888 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             if (scan->rs_nblocks == 0 || scan->rs_numblocks == 0)
     889                 :            :             {
     890                 :            :                 Assert(!BufferIsValid(scan->rs_cbuf));
     891                 :          0 :                 tuple->t_data = NULL;
     892                 :          0 :                 return;
     893                 :            :             }
     894                 :            : 
     895                 :            :             /*
     896                 :            :              * Disable reporting to syncscan logic in a backwards scan; it's
     897                 :            :              * not very likely anyone else is doing the same thing at the same
     898                 :            :              * time, and much more likely that we'll just bollix things for
     899                 :            :              * forward scanners.
     900                 :            :              */

    1097                 :            : fastgetattr(HeapTuple tup, int attnum, TupleDesc tupleDesc,

    1107                 :            :               (

    1109                 :            :                         (char *) (tup)->t_data + (tup)->t_data->t_hoff +
    1110                 :            :                         TupleDescAttr((tupleDesc), (attnum) - 1)->attcacheoff)

    1142                 :            : 
    1143                 :            : TableScanDesc
    1144                 :    2757925 : heap_beginscan(Relation relation, Snapshot snapshot,
    1145                 :            :                int nkeys, ScanKey key,
    1146                 :            :                ParallelTableScanDesc parallel_scan,
    1147                 :            :                uint32 flags)
    1148                 :            : {
    1149                 :            :     HeapScanDesc scan;
    1150                 :            : 
    1151                 :            :     /*
    1152                 :            :      * increment relation ref count while scanning relation
    1153                 :            :      *
    1154                 :            :      * This is just to make really sure the relcache entry won't go away while
    1155                 :            :      * the scan has a pointer to it.  Caller should be holding the rel open
    1156                 :            :      * anyway, so this is redundant in all normal scenarios...
    1157                 :            :      */
    1158                 :    2757925 :     RelationIncrementReferenceCount(relation);
    1159                 :            : 
    1160                 :            :     /*
    1161                 :            :      * allocate and initialize scan descriptor
    1162                 :            :      */
    1163                 :    2757925 :     scan = (HeapScanDesc) palloc(sizeof(HeapScanDescData));
    1164                 :            : 
    1165                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_base.rs_rd = relation;
    1166                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_base.rs_snapshot = snapshot;
    1167                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_base.rs_nkeys = nkeys;
    1168                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_base.rs_flags = flags;
    1169                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_base.rs_parallel = parallel_scan;
    1170                 :    2757925 :     scan->rs_strategy = NULL;    /* set in initscan */
    1171                 :            : 
    1172                 :            :     /*
    1173                 :            :      * Disable page-at-a-time mode if it's not a MVCC-safe snapshot.
    1174                 :            :      */
    1175 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:    2757925 :     if (!(snapshot && IsMVCCSnapshot(snapshot)))
                 [ +  + ]
    1176                 :       5529 :         scan->rs_base.rs_flags &= ~SO_ALLOW_PAGEMODE;
    1177                 :            : 
    1178                 :            :     /*
    1179                 :            :      * For seqscan and sample scans in a serializable transaction, acquire a
    1180                 :            :      * predicate lock on the entire relation. This is required not only to
    1181                 :            :      * lock all the matching tuples, but also to conflict with new insertions
    1182                 :            :      * into the table. In an indexscan, we take page locks on the index pages
    1183                 :            :      * covering the range specified in the scan qual, but in a heap scan there
    1184                 :            :      * is nothing more fine-grained to lock. A bitmap scan is a different
    1185                 :            :      * story, there we have already scanned the index and locked the index
    1186                 :            :      * pages covering the predicate. But in that case we still have to lock
    1187                 :            :      * any matching heap tuples. For sample scan we could optimize the locking
    1188                 :            :      * to be at least page-level granularity, but we'd need to add per-tuple
    1189                 :            :      * locking for that.
    1190                 :            :      */
    1191         [ +  + ]:    2757925 :     if (scan->rs_base.rs_flags & (SO_TYPE_SEQSCAN | SO_TYPE_SAMPLESCAN))
    1192                 :            :     {
    1193                 :            :         /*
    1194                 :            :          * Ensure a missing snapshot is noticed reliably, even if the
    1195                 :            :          * isolation mode means predicate locking isn't performed (and
    1196                 :            :          * therefore the snapshot isn't used here).
    1197                 :            :          */
    1198                 :            :         Assert(snapshot);
    1199                 :    2681438 :         PredicateLockRelation(relation, snapshot);
    1200                 :            :     }
    1201                 :            :

    1300                 :            : 
    1301                 :            : HeapTuple
    1302                 :    1576866 : heap_getnext(TableScanDesc sscan, ScanDirection direction)
    1303                 :            : {
    1304                 :    1576866 :     HeapScanDesc scan = (HeapScanDesc) sscan;
    1305                 :            : 
    1306                 :            :     /*
    1307                 :            :      * This is still widely used directly, without going through table AM, so
    1308                 :            :      * add a safety check.  It's possible we should, at a later point,
    1309                 :            :      * downgrade this to an assert. The reason for checking the AM routine,
    1310                 :            :      * rather than the AM oid, is that this allows to write regression tests
    1311                 :            :      * that create another AM reusing the heap handler.
    1312                 :            :      */
    1313         [ -  + ]:    1576866 :     if (unlikely(sscan->rs_rd->rd_tableam != GetHeapamTableAmRoutine()))
    1314         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
    1315                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_FEATURE_NOT_SUPPORTED),
    1316                 :            :                  errmsg_internal("only heap AM is supported")));
    1317                 :            : 
    1318                 :            :     /* Note: no locking manipulations needed */
    1319                 :            : 
    1320                 :            :     HEAPDEBUG_1;                /* heap_getnext( info ) */
    1321                 :            : 
    1322         [ +  + ]:    1576866 :     if (scan->rs_base.rs_flags & SO_ALLOW_PAGEMODE)
    1323                 :    1572123 :         heapgettup_pagemode(scan, direction,
    1324                 :    1572123 :                             scan->rs_base.rs_nkeys, scan->rs_base.rs_key);
    1325                 :            :     else
    1326                 :       4743 :         heapgettup(scan, direction,
    1327                 :       4743 :                    scan->rs_base.rs_nkeys, scan->rs_base.rs_key);
    1328                 :            : 
    1329         [ +  + ]:    1576866 :     if (scan->rs_ctup.t_data == NULL)
    1330                 :            :     {
    1331                 :            :         HEAPDEBUG_2;            /* heap_getnext returning EOS */
    1332                 :      14599 :         return NULL;
    1333                 :            :     }
    1334                 :            : 
    1335                 :            :     /*
    1336                 :            :      * if we get here it means we have a new current scan tuple, so point to
    1337                 :            :      * the proper return buffer and return the tuple.
    1338                 :            :      */
    1339                 :            :     HEAPDEBUG_3;                /* heap_getnext returning tuple */
    1340                 :            : 
    1341         [ +  - ]:    1562267 :     pgstat_count_heap_getnext(scan->rs_base.rs_rd);
    1342                 :            : 
    1343                 :    1562267 :     return &scan->rs_ctup;
    1344                 :            : }
    1345                 :            : 
    1346                 :            : #ifdef HEAPAMSLOTDEBUGALL
    1347                 :            : #define HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_1 \
    1348                 :            :     elog(DEBUG2, "heapam_getnextslot([%s,nkeys=%d],dir=%d) called", \
    1349                 :            :          RelationGetRelationName(scan->rs_base.rs_rd), scan->rs_base.rs_nkeys, (int) direction)
    1350                 :            : #define HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_2 \
    1351                 :            :     elog(DEBUG2, "heapam_getnextslot returning EOS")
    1352                 :            : #define HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_3 \
    1353                 :            :     elog(DEBUG2, "heapam_getnextslot returning tuple")
    1354                 :            : #else
    1355                 :            : #define HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_1
    1356                 :            : #define HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_2

    1359                 :            : 
    1360                 :            : bool
    1361                 :  544710755 : heap_getnextslot(TableScanDesc sscan, ScanDirection direction, TupleTableSlot *slot)
    1362                 :            : {
    1363                 :  544710755 :     HeapScanDesc scan = (HeapScanDesc) sscan;
    1364                 :            : 
    1365                 :            :     /* Note: no locking manipulations needed */
    1366                 :            : 
    1367                 :            :     HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_1;          /* heap_getnextslot( info ) */
    1368                 :            : 
    1369         [ +  - ]:  544710755 :     if (sscan->rs_flags & SO_ALLOW_PAGEMODE)
    1370                 :  544710755 :         heapgettup_pagemode(scan, direction, sscan->rs_nkeys, sscan->rs_key);
    1371                 :            :     else
    1372                 :          0 :         heapgettup(scan, direction, sscan->rs_nkeys, sscan->rs_key);
    1373                 :            : 
    1374         [ +  + ]:  544676678 :     if (scan->rs_ctup.t_data == NULL)
    1375                 :            :     {
    1376                 :            :         HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_2;      /* heap_getnextslot returning EOS */
    1377                 :    2585647 :         ExecClearTuple(slot);
    1378                 :    2585647 :         return false;
    1379                 :            :     }
    1380                 :            : 
    1381                 :            :     /*
    1382                 :            :      * if we get here it means we have a new current scan tuple, so point to
    1383                 :            :      * the proper return buffer and return the tuple.
    1384                 :            :      */
    1385                 :            :     HEAPAMSLOTDEBUG_3;          /* heap_getnextslot returning tuple */
    1386                 :            : 
    1387         [ +  - ]:  542091031 :     pgstat_count_heap_getnext(scan->rs_base.rs_rd);
    1388                 :            : 
    1389                 :  542091031 :     ExecStoreBufferHeapTuple(&scan->rs_ctup, slot,
    1390                 :            :                              scan->rs_cbuf);
    1391                 :  542091031 :     return true;
    1392                 :            : }
    1393                 :            : 
    1394                 :            : /*
    1395                 :            :  *  heap_fetch      - retrieve tuple with given tid
    1396                 :            :  *
    1397                 :            :  * On entry, tuple->t_self is the TID to fetch.  We pin the buffer holding
    1398                 :            :  * the tuple, fill in the remaining fields of *tuple, and check the tuple
    1399                 :            :  * against the specified snapshot.
    1400                 :            :  *
    1401                 :            :  * If successful (tuple found and passes snapshot time qual), then *userbuf
    1402                 :            :  * is set to the buffer holding the tuple and true is returned.  The caller
    1403                 :            :  * must unpin the buffer when done with the tuple.
    1404                 :            :  *
    1405                 :            :  * If the tuple is not found (ie, item number references a deleted slot),
    1406                 :            :  * then tuple->t_data is set to NULL and false is returned.
    1407                 :            :  *
    1408                 :            :  * If the tuple is found but fails the time qual check, then false is returned
    1409                 :            :  * but tuple->t_data is left pointing to the tuple.
    1410                 :            :  *
    1411                 :            :  * heap_fetch does not follow HOT chains: only the exact TID requested will
    1412                 :            :  * be fetched.
    1413                 :            :  *
    1414                 :            :  * It is somewhat inconsistent that we ereport() on invalid block number but
    1415                 :            :  * return false on invalid item number.  There are a couple of reasons though.
    1416                 :            :  * One is that the caller can relatively easily check the block number for
    1417                 :            :  * validity, but cannot check the item number without reading the page
    1418                 :            :  * himself.  Another is that when we are following a t_ctid link, we can be
    1419                 :            :  * reasonably confident that the page number is valid (since VACUUM shouldn't
    1420                 :            :  * truncate off the destination page without having killed the referencing
    1421                 :            :  * tuple first), but the item number might well not be good.
    1422                 :            :  */
    1423                 :            : bool
    1424                 :    2371160 : heap_fetch(Relation relation,
    1425                 :            :            Snapshot snapshot,
    1426                 :            :            HeapTuple tuple,
    1427                 :            :            Buffer *userbuf)
    1428                 :            : {
    1429                 :    2371160 :     ItemPointer tid = &(tuple->t_self);
    1430                 :            :     ItemId      lp;
    1431                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    1432                 :            :     Page        page;
    1433                 :            :     OffsetNumber offnum;
    1434                 :            :     bool        valid;
    1435                 :            : 
    1436                 :            :     /*
    1437                 :            :      * Fetch and pin the appropriate page of the relation.
    1438                 :            :      */
    1439                 :    2371160 :     buffer = ReadBuffer(relation, ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(tid));
    1440                 :            : 
    1441                 :            :     /*
    1442                 :            :      * Need share lock on buffer to examine tuple commit status.
    1443                 :            :      */
    1444                 :    2371160 :     LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
    1445         [ -  + ]:    2371160 :     page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    1446                 :    2371160 :     TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, relation, page);
    1447                 :            : 
    1448                 :            :     /*
    1449                 :            :      * We'd better check for out-of-range offnum in case of VACUUM since the
    1450                 :            :      * TID was obtained.
    1451                 :            :      */
    1452                 :    2371160 :     offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(tid);
    1453 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:    2371160 :     if (offnum < FirstOffsetNumber || offnum > PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page))
                 [ -  + ]
    1454                 :            :     {
    1455                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    1456                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1457                 :          0 :         *userbuf = InvalidBuffer;
    1458                 :          0 :         tuple->t_data = NULL;
    1459                 :          0 :         return false;
    1460                 :            :     }
    1461                 :            : 
    1462                 :            :     /*
    1463                 :            :      * get the item line pointer corresponding to the requested tid
    1464                 :            :      */
    1465                 :    2371160 :     lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    1466                 :            : 
    1467                 :            :     /*
    1468                 :            :      * Must check for deleted tuple.
    1469                 :            :      */
    1470         [ +  + ]:    2371160 :     if (!ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
    1471                 :            :     {
    1472                 :       1626 :         LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    1473                 :       1626 :         ReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1474                 :       1626 :         *userbuf = InvalidBuffer;
    1475                 :       1626 :         tuple->t_data = NULL;
    1476                 :       1626 :         return false;
    1477                 :            :     }
    1478                 :            : 
    1479                 :            :     /*
    1480                 :            :      * fill in *tuple fields
    1481                 :            :      */
    1482                 :    2369534 :     tuple->t_data = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    1483                 :    2369534 :     tuple->t_len = ItemIdGetLength(lp);
    1484                 :    2369534 :     tuple->t_tableOid = RelationGetRelid(relation);
    1485                 :            : 
    1486                 :            :     /*
    1487                 :            :      * check tuple visibility, then release lock
    1488                 :            :      */
    1489                 :    2369534 :     valid = HeapTupleSatisfiesVisibility(tuple, snapshot, buffer);
    1490                 :            : 
    1491         [ +  + ]:    2369534 :     if (valid)
    1492                 :    2369439 :         PredicateLockTuple(relation, tuple, snapshot);
    1493                 :            : 
    1494                 :    2369534 :     CheckForSerializableConflictOut(valid, relation, tuple, buffer, snapshot);
    1495                 :            : 
    1496                 :    2369534 :     LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    1497                 :            : 
    1498         [ +  + ]:    2369534 :     if (valid)
    1499                 :            :     {
    1500                 :            :         /*
    1501                 :            :          * All checks passed, so return the tuple as valid. Caller is now
    1502                 :            :          * responsible for releasing the buffer.
    1503                 :            :          */
    1504                 :    2369439 :         *userbuf = buffer;
    1505                 :            : 
    1506                 :    2369439 :         return true;
    1507                 :            :     }
    1508                 :            : 
    1509                 :            :     /* Tuple failed time qual */
    1510                 :         95 :     ReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1511                 :         95 :     *userbuf = InvalidBuffer;
    1512                 :            : 
    1513                 :         95 :     return false;
    1514                 :            : }
    1515                 :            : 
    1516                 :            : /*
    1517                 :            :  *  heap_hot_search_buffer  - search HOT chain for tuple satisfying snapshot
    1518                 :            :  *
    1519                 :            :  * On entry, *tid is the TID of a tuple (either a simple tuple, or the root
    1520                 :            :  * of a HOT chain), and buffer is the buffer holding this tuple.  We search
    1521                 :            :  * for the first chain member satisfying the given snapshot.  If one is
    1522                 :            :  * found, we update *tid to reference that tuple's offset number, and
    1523                 :            :  * return true.  If no match, return false without modifying *tid.
    1524                 :            :  *
    1525                 :            :  * heapTuple is a caller-supplied buffer.  When a match is found, we return
    1526                 :            :  * the tuple here, in addition to updating *tid.  If no match is found, the
    1527                 :            :  * contents of this buffer on return are undefined.
    1528                 :            :  *
    1529                 :            :  * If all_dead is not NULL, we check non-visible tuples to see if they are
    1530                 :            :  * globally dead; *all_dead is set true if all members of the HOT chain
    1531                 :            :  * are vacuumable, false if not.
    1532                 :            :  *
    1533                 :            :  * Unlike heap_fetch, the caller must already have pin and (at least) share
    1534                 :            :  * lock on the buffer; it is still pinned/locked at exit.  Also unlike
    1535                 :            :  * heap_fetch, we do not report any pgstats count; caller may do so if wanted.
    1536                 :            :  */
    1537                 :            : bool
    1538                 :   38591472 : heap_hot_search_buffer(ItemPointer tid, Relation relation, Buffer buffer,
    1539                 :            :                        Snapshot snapshot, HeapTuple heapTuple,
    1540                 :            :                        bool *all_dead, bool first_call)
    1541                 :            : {
    1542         [ -  + ]:   38591472 :     Page        dp = (Page) BufferGetPage(buffer);
    1543                 :   38591472 :     TransactionId prev_xmax = InvalidTransactionId;
    1544                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    1545                 :            :     OffsetNumber offnum;
    1546                 :            :     bool        at_chain_start;
    1547                 :            :     bool        valid;
    1548                 :            :     bool        skip;
    1549                 :            : 
    1550                 :            :     /* If this is not the first call, previous call returned a (live!) tuple */
    1551         [ +  + ]:   38591472 :     if (all_dead)
    1552                 :   36392198 :         *all_dead = first_call;
    1553                 :            : 
    1554                 :   38591472 :     blkno = ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(tid);
    1555                 :   38591472 :     offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(tid);
    1556                 :   38591472 :     at_chain_start = first_call;
    1557                 :   38591472 :     skip = !first_call;
    1558                 :            : 
    1559                 :            :     Assert(TransactionIdIsValid(RecentGlobalXmin));
    1560                 :            :     Assert(BufferGetBlockNumber(buffer) == blkno);
    1561                 :            : 
    1562                 :            :     /* Scan through possible multiple members of HOT-chain */
    1563                 :            :     for (;;)
    1564                 :            :     {
    1565                 :            :         ItemId      lp;
    1566                 :            : 
    1567                 :            :         /* check for bogus TID */
    1568 [ +  - ][ +  + ]:   41406574 :         if (offnum < FirstOffsetNumber || offnum > PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(dp))
                 [ +  + ]
    1569                 :            :             break;
    1570                 :            : 
    1571                 :   41404194 :         lp = PageGetItemId(dp, offnum);
    1572                 :            :

    1575                 :            :         {
    1576                 :            :             /* We should only see a redirect at start of chain */
    1577 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:    2081284 :             if (ItemIdIsRedirected(lp) && at_chain_start)
    1578                 :            :             {
    1579                 :            :                 /* Follow the redirect */

    1581                 :    1364469 :                 at_chain_start = false;
    1582                 :    1364469 :                 continue;
    1583                 :            :             }
    1584                 :            :             /* else must be end of chain */
    1585                 :     716815 :             break;
    1586                 :            :         }
    1587                 :            : 
    1588                 :            :         /*
    1589                 :            :          * Update heapTuple to point to the element of the HOT chain we're
    1590                 :            :          * currently investigating. Having t_self set correctly is important
    1591                 :            :          * because the SSI checks and the *Satisfies routine for historical
    1592                 :            :          * MVCC snapshots need the correct tid to decide about the visibility.
    1593                 :            :          */
    1594                 :   39322910 :         heapTuple->t_data = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(dp, lp);

    1598                 :            :

    1601                 :            :          */
    1602 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:   39322910 :         if (at_chain_start && HeapTupleIsHeapOnly(heapTuple))
    1603                 :          0 :             break;
    1604                 :            : 
    1605                 :            :         /*
    1606                 :            :          * The xmin should match the previous xmax value, else chain is
    1607                 :            :          * broken.
    1608                 :            :          */
    1609 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:   40773543 :         if (TransactionIdIsValid(prev_xmax) &&
    1610         [ +  - ]:    1450633 :             !TransactionIdEquals(prev_xmax,
    1611                 :            :                                  HeapTupleHeaderGetXmin(heapTuple->t_data)))

    1614                 :            :         /*
    1615                 :            :          * When first_call is true (and thus, skip is initially false) we'll
    1616                 :            :          * return the first tuple we find.  But on later passes, heapTuple
    1617                 :            :          * will initially be pointing to the tuple we returned last time.
    1618                 :            :          * Returning it again would be incorrect (and would loop forever), so
    1619                 :            :          * we skip it and return the next match we find.
    1620                 :            :          */
    1621         [ +  + ]:   39322906 :         if (!skip)

    1643                 :            :          *
