    1669                 :            : 
    1670                 :            : /*
    1671                 :            :  *  heap_get_latest_tid -  get the latest tid of a specified tuple
    1672                 :            :  *
    1673                 :            :  * Actually, this gets the latest version that is visible according to the
    1674                 :            :  * scan's snapshot.  Create a scan using SnapshotDirty to get the very latest,
    1675                 :            :  * possibly uncommitted version.
    1676                 :            :  *
    1677                 :            :  * *tid is both an input and an output parameter: it is updated to
    1678                 :            :  * show the latest version of the row.  Note that it will not be changed
    1679                 :            :  * if no version of the row passes the snapshot test.
    1680                 :            :  */
    1681                 :            : void
    1682                 :          0 : heap_get_latest_tid(TableScanDesc sscan,
    1683                 :            :                     ItemPointer tid)
    1684                 :            : {
    1685                 :          0 :     Relation    relation = sscan->rs_rd;
    1686                 :          0 :     Snapshot    snapshot = sscan->rs_snapshot;
    1687                 :            :     ItemPointerData ctid;
    1688                 :            :     TransactionId priorXmax;
    1689                 :            : 
    1690                 :            :     /*
    1691                 :            :      * table_tuple_get_latest_tid() verified that the passed in tid is valid.
    1692                 :            :      * Assume that t_ctid links are valid however - there shouldn't be invalid
    1693                 :            :      * ones in the table.
    1694                 :            :      */
    1695                 :            :     Assert(ItemPointerIsValid(tid));
    1696                 :            : 
    1697                 :            :     /*
    1698                 :            :      * Loop to chase down t_ctid links.  At top of loop, ctid is the tuple we
    1699                 :            :      * need to examine, and *tid is the TID we will return if ctid turns out
    1700                 :            :      * to be bogus.
    1701                 :            :      *
    1702                 :            :      * Note that we will loop until we reach the end of the t_ctid chain.
    1703                 :            :      * Depending on the snapshot passed, there might be at most one visible
    1704                 :            :      * version of the row, but we don't try to optimize for that.
    1705                 :            :      */
    1706                 :          0 :     ctid = *tid;
    1707                 :          0 :     priorXmax = InvalidTransactionId;   /* cannot check first XMIN */
    1708                 :            :     for (;;)
    1709                 :            :     {
    1710                 :            :         Buffer      buffer;
    1711                 :            :         Page        page;
    1712                 :            :         OffsetNumber offnum;
    1713                 :            :         ItemId      lp;
    1714                 :            :         HeapTupleData tp;
    1715                 :            :         bool        valid;
    1716                 :            : 
    1717                 :            :         /*
    1718                 :            :          * Read, pin, and lock the page.
    1719                 :            :          */
    1720                 :          0 :         buffer = ReadBuffer(relation, ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(&ctid));
    1721                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
    1722         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    1723                 :          0 :         TestForOldSnapshot(snapshot, relation, page);
    1724                 :            : 
    1725                 :            :         /*
    1726                 :            :          * Check for bogus item number.  This is not treated as an error
    1727                 :            :          * condition because it can happen while following a t_ctid link. We
    1728                 :            :          * just assume that the prior tid is OK and return it unchanged.
    1729                 :            :          */
    1730                 :          0 :         offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&ctid);
    1731 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (offnum < FirstOffsetNumber || offnum > PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page))
                 [ #  # ]
    1732                 :            :         {
    1733                 :          0 :             UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1734                 :          0 :             break;
    1735                 :            :         }
    1736                 :          0 :         lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    1737         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
    1738                 :            :         {
    1739                 :          0 :             UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1740                 :          0 :             break;
    1741                 :            :         }
    1742                 :            : 
    1743                 :            :         /* OK to access the tuple */
    1744                 :          0 :         tp.t_self = ctid;
    1745                 :          0 :         tp.t_data = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    1746                 :          0 :         tp.t_len = ItemIdGetLength(lp);
    1747                 :          0 :         tp.t_tableOid = RelationGetRelid(relation);
    1748                 :            : 
    1749                 :            :         /*
    1750                 :            :          * After following a t_ctid link, we might arrive at an unrelated
    1751                 :            :          * tuple.  Check for XMIN match.
    1752                 :            :          */
    1753 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (TransactionIdIsValid(priorXmax) &&
    1754         [ #  # ]:          0 :             !TransactionIdEquals(priorXmax, HeapTupleHeaderGetXmin(tp.t_data)))
    1755                 :            :         {
    1756                 :          0 :             UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1757                 :          0 :             break;
    1758                 :            :         }
    1759                 :            : 
    1760                 :            :         /*
    1761                 :            :          * Check tuple visibility; if visible, set it as the new result
    1762                 :            :          * candidate.
    1763                 :            :          */
    1764                 :          0 :         valid = HeapTupleSatisfiesVisibility(&tp, snapshot, buffer);
    1765                 :          0 :         CheckForSerializableConflictOut(valid, relation, &tp, buffer, snapshot);
    1766         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (valid)
    1767                 :          0 :             *tid = ctid;
    1768                 :            : 
    1769                 :            :         /*
    1770                 :            :          * If there's a valid t_ctid link, follow it, else we're done.
    1771                 :            :          */
    1772   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :         if ((tp.t_data->t_infomask & HEAP_XMAX_INVALID) ||
    1773         [ #  # ]:          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderIsOnlyLocked(tp.t_data) ||
    1774   [ #  #  #  # ]:          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderIndicatesMovedPartitions(tp.t_data) ||
    1775                 :          0 :             ItemPointerEquals(&tp.t_self, &tp.t_data->t_ctid))
    1776                 :            :         {
    1777                 :          0 :             UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1778                 :          0 :             break;
    1779                 :            :         }
    1780                 :            : 
    1781                 :          0 :         ctid = tp.t_data->t_ctid;
    1782 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         priorXmax = HeapTupleHeaderGetUpdateXid(tp.t_data);
                 [ #  # ]
    1783                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    1784                 :          0 :     }                           /* end of loop */
    1785                 :          0 : }
    1786                 :            : 
    1787                 :            : 
    1788                 :            : /*
    1789                 :            :  * UpdateXmaxHintBits - update tuple hint bits after xmax transaction ends
    1790                 :            :  *
    1791                 :            :  * This is called after we have waited for the XMAX transaction to terminate.
    1792                 :            :  * If the transaction aborted, we guarantee the XMAX_INVALID hint bit will
    1793                 :            :  * be set on exit.  If the transaction committed, we set the XMAX_COMMITTED
    1794                 :            :  * hint bit if possible --- but beware that that may not yet be possible,
    1795                 :            :  * if the transaction committed asynchronously.
    1796                 :            :  *
    1797                 :            :  * Note that if the transaction was a locker only, we set HEAP_XMAX_INVALID
    1798                 :            :  * even if it commits.
    1799                 :            :  *
    1800                 :            :  * Hence callers should look only at XMAX_INVALID.
    1801                 :            :  *
    1802                 :            :  * Note this is not allowed for tuples whose xmax is a multixact.
    1803                 :            :  */
    1804                 :            : static void
    1805                 :      37859 : UpdateXmaxHintBits(HeapTupleHeader tuple, Buffer buffer, TransactionId xid)
    1806                 :            : {
    1807                 :            :     Assert(TransactionIdEquals(HeapTupleHeaderGetRawXmax(tuple), xid));
    1808                 :            :     Assert(!(tuple->t_infomask & HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI));
    1809                 :            : 
    1810         [ +  + ]:      37859 :     if (!(tuple->t_infomask & (HEAP_XMAX_COMMITTED | HEAP_XMAX_INVALID)))
    1811                 :            :     {
    1812         [ +  + ]:      46299 :         if (!HEAP_XMAX_IS_LOCKED_ONLY(tuple->t_infomask) &&
           [ +  -  +  + ]
    1813                 :       9624 :             TransactionIdDidCommit(xid))
    1814                 :       3327 :             HeapTupleSetHintBits(tuple, buffer, HEAP_XMAX_COMMITTED,
    1815                 :            :                                  xid);
    1816                 :            :         else
    1817                 :      33348 :             HeapTupleSetHintBits(tuple, buffer, HEAP_XMAX_INVALID,
    1818                 :            :                                  InvalidTransactionId);
    1819                 :            :     }
    1820                 :      37859 : }
    1821                 :            : 
    1822                 :            : 
    1823                 :            : /*
    1824                 :            :  * GetBulkInsertState - prepare status object for a bulk insert
    1825                 :            :  */

    1836                 :            :

    1844                 :         10 :         ReleaseBuffer(bistate->current_buf);
    1845                 :         10 :     FreeAccessStrategy(bistate->strategy);
    1846                 :         10 :     pfree(bistate);
    1847                 :         10 : }

    1851                 :            :  */

    1859                 :            : 
    1860                 :            : 
    1861                 :            : /*
    1862                 :            :  *  heap_insert     - insert tuple into a heap
    1863                 :            :  *
    1864                 :            :  * The new tuple is stamped with current transaction ID and the specified
    1865                 :            :  * command ID.
    1866                 :            :  *
    1867                 :            :  * See table_tuple_insert for comments about most of the input flags, except
    1868                 :            :  * that this routine directly takes a tuple rather than a slot.
    1869                 :            :  *
    1870                 :            :  * There's corresponding HEAP_INSERT_ options to all the TABLE_INSERT_
    1871                 :            :  * options, and there additionally is HEAP_INSERT_SPECULATIVE which is used to
    1872                 :            :  * implement table_tuple_insert_speculative().
    1873                 :            :  *
    1874                 :            :  * On return the header fields of *tup are updated to match the stored tuple;
    1875                 :            :  * in particular tup->t_self receives the actual TID where the tuple was
    1876                 :            :  * stored.  But note that any toasting of fields within the tuple data is NOT
    1877                 :            :  * reflected into *tup.
    1878                 :            :  */
    1879                 :            : void
    1880                 :     440066 : heap_insert(Relation relation, HeapTuple tup, CommandId cid,
    1881                 :            :             int options, BulkInsertState bistate)
    1882                 :            : {
    1883                 :     440066 :     TransactionId xid = GetCurrentTransactionId();
    1884                 :            :     HeapTuple   heaptup;
    1885                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    1886                 :     440066 :     Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    1887                 :     440066 :     bool        all_visible_cleared = false;
    1888                 :            : 
    1889                 :            :     /* Cheap, simplistic check that the tuple matches the rel's rowtype. */
    1890                 :            :     Assert(HeapTupleHeaderGetNatts(tup->t_data) <=
    1891                 :            :            RelationGetNumberOfAttributes(relation));
    1892                 :            : 
    1893                 :            :     /*
    1894                 :            :      * Fill in tuple header fields and toast the tuple if necessary.
    1895                 :            :      *
    1896                 :            :      * Note: below this point, heaptup is the data we actually intend to store
    1897                 :            :      * into the relation; tup is the caller's original untoasted data.
    1898                 :            :      */
    1899                 :     440066 :     heaptup = heap_prepare_insert(relation, tup, xid, cid, options);
    1900                 :            : 
    1901                 :            :     /*
    1902                 :            :      * Find buffer to insert this tuple into.  If the page is all visible,
    1903                 :            :      * this will also pin the requisite visibility map page.
    1904                 :            :      */
    1905                 :     440065 :     buffer = RelationGetBufferForTuple(relation, heaptup->t_len,
    1906                 :            :                                        InvalidBuffer, options, bistate,
    1907                 :            :                                        &vmbuffer, NULL);
    1908                 :            : 
    1909                 :            :     /*
    1910                 :            :      * We're about to do the actual insert -- but check for conflict first, to
    1911                 :            :      * avoid possibly having to roll back work we've just done.
    1912                 :            :      *
    1913                 :            :      * This is safe without a recheck as long as there is no possibility of
    1914                 :            :      * another process scanning the page between this check and the insert
    1915                 :            :      * being visible to the scan (i.e., an exclusive buffer content lock is
    1916                 :            :      * continuously held from this point until the tuple insert is visible).
    1917                 :            :      *
    1918                 :            :      * For a heap insert, we only need to check for table-level SSI locks. Our
    1919                 :            :      * new tuple can't possibly conflict with existing tuple locks, and heap
    1920                 :            :      * page locks are only consolidated versions of tuple locks; they do not
    1921                 :            :      * lock "gaps" as index page locks do.  So we don't need to specify a
    1922                 :            :      * buffer when making the call, which makes for a faster check.
    1923                 :            :      */
    1924                 :     440065 :     CheckForSerializableConflictIn(relation, NULL, InvalidBuffer);
    1925                 :            : 
    1926                 :            :     /* NO EREPORT(ERROR) from here till changes are logged */
    1927                 :     440065 :     START_CRIT_SECTION();
    1928                 :            : 
    1929                 :     440065 :     RelationPutHeapTuple(relation, buffer, heaptup,
    1930                 :     440065 :                          (options & HEAP_INSERT_SPECULATIVE) != 0);
    1931                 :            : 
    1932 [ -  + ][ +  + ]:     440065 :     if (PageIsAllVisible(BufferGetPage(buffer)))
    1933                 :            :     {
    1934                 :       3069 :         all_visible_cleared = true;
    1935 [ -  + ][ -  + ]:       3069 :         PageClearAllVisible(BufferGetPage(buffer));
    1936                 :       3069 :         visibilitymap_clear(relation,
    1937                 :       3069 :                             ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(&(heaptup->t_self)),
    1938                 :            :                             vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    1939                 :            :     }
    1940                 :            : 
    1941                 :            :     /*
    1942                 :            :      * XXX Should we set PageSetPrunable on this page ?
    1943                 :            :      *
    1944                 :            :      * The inserting transaction may eventually abort thus making this tuple
    1945                 :            :      * DEAD and hence available for pruning. Though we don't want to optimize
    1946                 :            :      * for aborts, if no other tuple in this page is UPDATEd/DELETEd, the
    1947                 :            :      * aborted tuple will never be pruned until next vacuum is triggered.
    1948                 :            :      *
    1949                 :            :      * If you do add PageSetPrunable here, add it in heap_xlog_insert too.
    1950                 :            :      */
    1951                 :            :

    1954                 :            :     /* XLOG stuff */

         [ +  + ][ -  + ]

    1976 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:     440065 :         if (ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&(heaptup->t_self)) == FirstOffsetNumber &&

    2021                 :            :

    2023                 :     440065 :         XLogSetRecordFlags(XLOG_INCLUDE_ORIGIN);

    2026                 :            :

    2028                 :            :     }
    2029                 :            : 
    2030                 :     440065 :     END_CRIT_SECTION();

    2032                 :     440065 :     UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    2033         [ +  + ]:     440065 :     if (vmbuffer != InvalidBuffer)
    2034                 :       3069 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    2035                 :            : 
    2036                 :            :     /*
    2037                 :            :      * If tuple is cachable, mark it for invalidation from the caches in case
    2038                 :            :      * we abort.  Note it is OK to do this after releasing the buffer, because
    2039                 :            :      * the heaptup data structure is all in local memory, not in the shared
    2040                 :            :      * buffer.

    2042                 :     440065 :     CacheInvalidateHeapTuple(relation, heaptup, NULL);
    2043                 :            : 
    2044                 :            :     /* Note: speculative insertions are counted too, even if aborted later */
    2045                 :     440065 :     pgstat_count_heap_insert(relation, 1);
    2046                 :            : 
    2047                 :            :     /*
    2048                 :            :      * If heaptup is a private copy, release it.  Don't forget to copy t_self
    2049                 :            :      * back to the caller's image, too.
    2050                 :            :      */
    2051         [ +  + ]:     440065 :     if (heaptup != tup)
    2052                 :            :     {
    2053                 :       2667 :         tup->t_self = heaptup->t_self;
    2054                 :       2667 :         heap_freetuple(heaptup);
    2055                 :            :     }
    2056                 :     440065 : }
    2057                 :            : 
    2058                 :            : /*
    2059                 :            :  * Subroutine for heap_insert(). Prepares a tuple for insertion. This sets the
    2060                 :            :  * tuple header fields and toasts the tuple if necessary.  Returns a toasted
    2061                 :            :  * version of the tuple if it was toasted, or the original tuple if not. Note
    2062                 :            :  * that in any case, the header fields are also set in the original tuple.
    2063                 :            :  */
    2064                 :            : static HeapTuple
    2065                 :    1940066 : heap_prepare_insert(Relation relation, HeapTuple tup, TransactionId xid,
    2066                 :            :                     CommandId cid, int options)
    2067                 :            : {
    2068                 :            :     /*
    2069                 :            :      * Parallel operations are required to be strictly read-only in a parallel
    2070                 :            :      * worker.  Parallel inserts are not safe even in the leader in the
    2071                 :            :      * general case, because group locking means that heavyweight locks for
    2072                 :            :      * relation extension or GIN page locks will not conflict between members
    2073                 :            :      * of a lock group, but we don't prohibit that case here because there are
    2074                 :            :      * useful special cases that we can safely allow, such as CREATE TABLE AS.
    2075                 :            :      */
    2076         [ -  + ]:    1940066 :     if (IsParallelWorker())
    2077         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
    2078                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TRANSACTION_STATE),
    2079                 :            :                  errmsg("cannot insert tuples in a parallel worker")));
    2080                 :            : 
    2081                 :    1940066 :     tup->t_data->t_infomask &= ~(HEAP_XACT_MASK);
    2082                 :    1940066 :     tup->t_data->t_infomask2 &= ~(HEAP2_XACT_MASK);
    2083                 :    1940066 :     tup->t_data->t_infomask |= HEAP_XMAX_INVALID;
    2084                 :    1940066 :     HeapTupleHeaderSetXmin(tup->t_data, xid);
    2085         [ -  + ]:    1940066 :     if (options & HEAP_INSERT_FROZEN)
    2086                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetXminFrozen(tup->t_data);
    2087                 :            : 
    2088                 :    1940066 :     HeapTupleHeaderSetCmin(tup->t_data, cid);
    2089                 :    1940066 :     HeapTupleHeaderSetXmax(tup->t_data, 0); /* for cleanliness */
    2090                 :    1940066 :     tup->t_tableOid = RelationGetRelid(relation);
    2091                 :            : 
    2092                 :            :     /*
    2093                 :            :      * If the new tuple is too big for storage or contains already toasted
    2094                 :            :      * out-of-line attributes from some other relation, invoke the toaster.
    2095                 :            :      */
    2096 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:    1940066 :     if (relation->rd_rel->relkind != RELKIND_RELATION &&
    2097                 :      23915 :         relation->rd_rel->relkind != RELKIND_MATVIEW)
    2098                 :            :     {
    2099                 :            :         /* toast table entries should never be recursively toasted */
    2100                 :            :         Assert(!HeapTupleHasExternal(tup));
    2101                 :      23915 :         return tup;
    2102                 :            :     }
    2103 [ +  - ][ +  + ]:    1916151 :     else if (HeapTupleHasExternal(tup) || tup->t_len > TOAST_TUPLE_THRESHOLD)
    2104                 :       2668 :         return toast_insert_or_update(relation, tup, NULL, options);
    2105                 :            :     else
    2106                 :    1913483 :         return tup;
    2107                 :            : }
    2108                 :            : 
    2109                 :            : /*
    2110                 :            :  *  heap_multi_insert   - insert multiple tuple into a heap
    2111                 :            :  *
    2112                 :            :  * This is like heap_insert(), but inserts multiple tuples in one operation.
    2113                 :            :  * That's faster than calling heap_insert() in a loop, because when multiple
    2114                 :            :  * tuples can be inserted on a single page, we can write just a single WAL
    2115                 :            :  * record covering all of them, and only need to lock/unlock the page once.
    2116                 :            :  *
    2117                 :            :  * Note: this leaks memory into the current memory context. You can create a
    2118                 :            :  * temporary context before calling this, if that's a problem.
    2119                 :            :  */
    2120                 :            : void
    2121                 :      21164 : heap_multi_insert(Relation relation, TupleTableSlot **slots, int ntuples,
    2122                 :            :                   CommandId cid, int options, BulkInsertState bistate)
    2123                 :            : {
    2124                 :      21164 :     TransactionId xid = GetCurrentTransactionId();
    2125                 :            :     HeapTuple  *heaptuples;
    2126                 :            :     int         i;
    2127                 :            :     int         ndone;
    2128                 :            :     PGAlignedBlock scratch;
    2129                 :            :     Page        page;
    2130                 :            :     bool        needwal;
    2131                 :            :     Size        saveFreeSpace;
    2132 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:      21164 :     bool        need_tuple_data = RelationIsLogicallyLogged(relation);
                 [ +  - ]
    2133 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:      21164 :     bool        need_cids = RelationIsAccessibleInLogicalDecoding(relation);
         [ +  - ][ -  + ]
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ #  # ]
    2134                 :            : 
    2135                 :            :     /* currently not needed (thus unsupported) for heap_multi_insert() */
    2136                 :            :     AssertArg(!(options & HEAP_INSERT_NO_LOGICAL));
    2137                 :            : 
    2138 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:      21164 :     needwal = !(options & HEAP_INSERT_SKIP_WAL) && RelationNeedsWAL(relation);
    2139         [ -  + ]:      21164 :     saveFreeSpace = RelationGetTargetPageFreeSpace(relation,
    2140                 :            :                                                    HEAP_DEFAULT_FILLFACTOR);
    2141                 :            : 
    2142                 :            :     /* Toast and set header data in all the slots */
    2143                 :      21164 :     heaptuples = palloc(ntuples * sizeof(HeapTuple));
    2144         [ +  + ]:    1521164 :     for (i = 0; i < ntuples; i++)
    2145                 :            :     {
    2146                 :            :         HeapTuple   tuple;
    2147                 :            : 
    2148                 :    1500000 :         tuple = ExecFetchSlotHeapTuple(slots[i], true, NULL);
    2149                 :    1500000 :         slots[i]->tts_tableOid = RelationGetRelid(relation);
    2150                 :    1500000 :         tuple->t_tableOid = slots[i]->tts_tableOid;
    2151                 :    1500000 :         heaptuples[i] = heap_prepare_insert(relation, tuple, xid, cid,
    2152                 :            :                                             options);
    2153                 :            :     }
    2154                 :            : 
    2155                 :            :     /*
    2156                 :            :      * We're about to do the actual inserts -- but check for conflict first,
    2157                 :            :      * to minimize the possibility of having to roll back work we've just
    2158                 :            :      * done.
    2159                 :            :      *
    2160                 :            :      * A check here does not definitively prevent a serialization anomaly;
    2161                 :            :      * that check MUST be done at least past the point of acquiring an
    2162                 :            :      * exclusive buffer content lock on every buffer that will be affected,
    2163                 :            :      * and MAY be done after all inserts are reflected in the buffers and
    2164                 :            :      * those locks are released; otherwise there race condition.  Since
    2165                 :            :      * multiple buffers can be locked and unlocked in the loop below, and it
    2166                 :            :      * would not be feasible to identify and lock all of those buffers before
    2167                 :            :      * the loop, we must do a final check at the end.
    2168                 :            :      *
    2169                 :            :      * The check here could be omitted with no loss of correctness; it is
    2170                 :            :      * present strictly as an optimization.
    2171                 :            :      *
    2172                 :            :      * For heap inserts, we only need to check for table-level SSI locks. Our
    2173                 :            :      * new tuples can't possibly conflict with existing tuple locks, and heap
    2174                 :            :      * page locks are only consolidated versions of tuple locks; they do not
    2175                 :            :      * lock "gaps" as index page locks do.  So we don't need to specify a
    2176                 :            :      * buffer when making the call, which makes for a faster check.
    2177                 :            :      */
    2178                 :      21164 :     CheckForSerializableConflictIn(relation, NULL, InvalidBuffer);
    2179                 :            :

    2355                 :            :     /*
    2356                 :            :      * We're done with the actual inserts.  Check for conflicts again, to
    2357                 :            :      * ensure that all rw-conflicts in to these inserts are detected.  Without
    2358                 :            :      * this final check, a sequential scan of the heap may have locked the
    2359                 :            :      * table after the "before" check, missing one opportunity to detect the
    2360                 :            :      * conflict, and then scanned the table before the new tuples were there,
    2361                 :            :      * missing the other chance to detect the conflict.
    2362                 :            :      *
    2363                 :            :      * For heap inserts, we only need to check for table-level SSI locks. Our
    2364                 :            :      * new tuples can't possibly conflict with existing tuple locks, and heap
    2365                 :            :      * page locks are only consolidated versions of tuple locks; they do not
    2366                 :            :      * lock "gaps" as index page locks do.  So we don't need to specify a
    2367                 :            :      * buffer when making the call.
    2368                 :            :      */

    2390                 :            : /*

    2395                 :            :  *

    2405                 :            : /*
    2406                 :            :  * Given infomask/infomask2, compute the bits that must be saved in the

    2408                 :            :  * xl_heap_lock_updated WAL records.

    2412                 :            : static uint8
    2413                 :   46333642 : compute_infobits(uint16 infomask, uint16 infomask2)
    2414                 :            : {
    2415 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:   46333642 :     return

    2418                 :   46333642 :         ((infomask & HEAP_XMAX_EXCL_LOCK) != 0 ? XLHL_XMAX_EXCL_LOCK : 0) |
    2419                 :            :     /* note we ignore HEAP_XMAX_SHR_LOCK here */
    2420                 :   46333642 :         ((infomask & HEAP_XMAX_KEYSHR_LOCK) != 0 ? XLHL_XMAX_KEYSHR_LOCK : 0) |
    2421                 :   46333642 :         ((infomask2 & HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED) != 0 ?
    2422                 :            :          XLHL_KEYS_UPDATED : 0);
    2423                 :            : }
    2424                 :            : 
    2425                 :            : /*
    2426                 :            :  * Given two versions of the same t_infomask for a tuple, compare them and
    2427                 :            :  * return whether the relevant status for a tuple Xmax has changed.  This is
    2428                 :            :  * used after a buffer lock has been released and reacquired: we want to ensure
    2429                 :            :  * that the tuple state continues to be the same it was when we previously
    2430                 :            :  * examined it.
    2431                 :            :  *
    2432                 :            :  * Note the Xmax field itself must be compared separately.
    2433                 :            :  */
    2434                 :            : static inline bool
    2435                 :    1918859 : xmax_infomask_changed(uint16 new_infomask, uint16 old_infomask)
    2436                 :            : {
    2437                 :    1918859 :     const uint16 interesting =
    2438                 :            :     HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI | HEAP_XMAX_LOCK_ONLY | HEAP_LOCK_MASK;
    2439                 :            : 
    2440         [ +  + ]:    1918859 :     if ((new_infomask & interesting) != (old_infomask & interesting))
    2441                 :      12997 :         return true;
    2442                 :            : 
    2443                 :    1905862 :     return false;
    2444                 :            : }
    2445                 :            : 
    2446                 :            : /*
    2447                 :            :  *  heap_delete - delete a tuple
    2448                 :            :  *
    2449                 :            :  * See table_tuple_delete() for an explanation of the parameters, except that
    2450                 :            :  * this routine directly takes a tuple rather than a slot.
    2451                 :            :  *
    2452                 :            :  * In the failure cases, the routine fills *tmfd with the tuple's t_ctid,
    2453                 :            :  * t_xmax (resolving a possible MultiXact, if necessary), and t_cmax (the last
    2454                 :            :  * only for TM_SelfModified, since we cannot obtain cmax from a combocid
    2455                 :            :  * generated by another transaction).
    2456                 :            :  */
    2457                 :            : TM_Result
    2458                 :       2922 : heap_delete(Relation relation, ItemPointer tid,

    2484                 :            :      * have no provision for broadcasting it to them.

    2498                 :            :      * in the middle of changing this, so we'll need to recheck after we have
    2499                 :            :      * the lock.

    2501         [ +  + ]:       2922 :     if (PageIsAllVisible(page))

    2506                 :            :     /*
    2507                 :            :      * If we didn't pin the visibility map page and the page has become all
    2508                 :            :      * visible while we were busy locking the buffer, we'll have to unlock and
    2509                 :            :      * re-lock, to avoid holding the buffer lock across an I/O.  That's a bit

    2511                 :            :      */

    2534                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_OBJECT_NOT_IN_PREREQUISITE_STATE),
    2535                 :            :                  errmsg("attempted to delete invisible tuple")));
    2536                 :            :     }
    2537 [ -  + ][ #  # ]:       2922 :     else if (result == TM_BeingModified && wait)
    2538                 :            :     {
    2539                 :            :         TransactionId xwait;
    2540                 :            :         uint16      infomask;
    2541                 :            : 
    2542                 :            :         /* must copy state data before unlocking buffer */
    2543                 :          0 :         xwait = HeapTupleHeaderGetRawXmax(tp.t_data);
    2544                 :          0 :         infomask = tp.t_data->t_infomask;
    2545                 :            : 
    2546                 :            :         /*
    2547                 :            :          * Sleep until concurrent transaction ends -- except when there's a
    2548                 :            :          * single locker and it's our own transaction.  Note we don't care
    2549                 :            :          * which lock mode the locker has, because we need the strongest one.
    2550                 :            :          *
    2551                 :            :          * Before sleeping, we need to acquire tuple lock to establish our
    2552                 :            :          * priority for the tuple (see heap_lock_tuple).  LockTuple will
    2553                 :            :          * release us when we are next-in-line for the tuple.
    2554                 :            :          *
    2555                 :            :          * If we are forced to "start over" below, we keep the tuple lock;
    2556                 :            :          * this arranges that we stay at the head of the line while rechecking
    2557                 :            :          * tuple state.
    2558                 :            :          */
    2559         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (infomask & HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI)
    2560                 :            :         {
    2561                 :          0 :             bool        current_is_member = false;
    2562                 :            : 
    2563         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (DoesMultiXactIdConflict((MultiXactId) xwait, infomask,
    2564                 :            :                                         LockTupleExclusive, &current_is_member))
    2565                 :            :             {
    2566                 :          0 :                 LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    2567                 :            : 
    2568                 :            :                 /*
    2569                 :            :                  * Acquire the lock, if necessary (but skip it when we're
    2570                 :            :                  * requesting a lock and already have one; avoids deadlock).
    2571                 :            :                  */
    2572         [ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (!current_is_member)
    2573                 :          0 :                     heap_acquire_tuplock(relation, &(tp.t_self), LockTupleExclusive,
    2574                 :            :                                          LockWaitBlock, &have_tuple_lock);
    2575                 :            : 
    2576                 :            :                 /* wait for multixact */
    2577                 :          0 :                 MultiXactIdWait((MultiXactId) xwait, MultiXactStatusUpdate, infomask,
    2578                 :            :                                 relation, &(tp.t_self), XLTW_Delete,
    2579                 :            :                                 NULL);
    2580                 :          0 :                 LockBuffer(buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_EXCLUSIVE);
    2581                 :            : 
    2582                 :            :                 /*
    2583                 :            :                  * If xwait had just locked the tuple then some other xact
    2584                 :            :                  * could update this tuple before we get to this point.  Check
    2585                 :            :                  * for xmax change, and start over if so.
    2586                 :            :                  */
    2587 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :                 if (xmax_infomask_changed(tp.t_data->t_infomask, infomask) ||
    2588                 :          0 :                     !TransactionIdEquals(HeapTupleHeaderGetRawXmax(tp.t_data),
    2589                 :            :                                          xwait))
    2590                 :            :                     goto l1;
    2591                 :            :             }
    2592                 :            : 
    2593                 :            :             /*
    2594                 :            :              * You might think the multixact is necessarily done here, but not
    2595                 :            :              * so: it could have surviving members, namely our own xact or
    2596                 :            :              * other subxacts of this backend.  It is legal for us to delete
    2597                 :            :              * the tuple in either case, however (the latter case is
    2598                 :            :              * essentially a situation of upgrading our former shared lock to
    2599                 :            :              * exclusive).  We don't bother changing the on-disk hint bits
    2600                 :            :              * since we are about to overwrite the xmax altogether.
    2601                 :            :              */
    2602                 :            :         }
    2603         [ #  # ]:          0 :         else if (!TransactionIdIsCurrentTransactionId(xwait))
    2604                 :            :         {

    2616                 :            :              * xwait is done, but if xwait had just locked the tuple then some

    2673                 :            : 
    2674                 :            :     /*
    2675                 :            :      * We're about to do the actual delete -- check for conflict first, to
    2676                 :            :      * avoid possibly having to roll back work we've just done.
    2677                 :            :      *
    2678                 :            :      * This is safe without a recheck as long as there is no possibility of
    2679                 :            :      * another process scanning the page between this check and the delete
    2680                 :            :      * being visible to the scan (i.e., an exclusive buffer content lock is
    2681                 :            :      * continuously held from this point until the tuple delete is visible).
    2682                 :            :      */
    2683                 :       2922 :     CheckForSerializableConflictIn(relation, &tp, buffer);

    2689                 :            :      * Compute replica identity tuple before entering the critical section so

    2692                 :       2922 :     old_key_tuple = ExtractReplicaIdentity(relation, &tp, true, &old_key_copied);
    2693                 :            : 
    2694                 :            :     /*

    2696                 :            :      * transaction, set my per-backend OldestMemberMXactId setting. We can be
    2697                 :            :      * certain that the transaction will never become a member of any older
    2698                 :            :      * MultiXactIds than that.  (We have to do this even if we end up just

    2714                 :            :      * falls below the OldestXmin horizon.  If the transaction finally aborts,
    2715                 :            :      * the subsequent page pruning will be a no-op and the hint will be

    2853                 :            : 
    2854                 :            : /*
    2855                 :            :  *  simple_heap_delete - delete a tuple
    2856                 :            :  *
    2857                 :            :  * This routine may be used to delete a tuple when concurrent updates of
    2858                 :            :  * the target tuple are not expected (for example, because we have a lock
    2859                 :            :  * on the relation associated with the tuple).  Any failure is reported
    2860                 :            :  * via ereport().
    2861                 :            :  */
    2862                 :            : void
    2863                 :       2922 : simple_heap_delete(Relation relation, ItemPointer tid)
    2864                 :            : {
    2865                 :            :     TM_Result   result;
    2866                 :            :     TM_FailureData tmfd;
    2867                 :            : 
    2868                 :       2922 :     result = heap_delete(relation, tid,
    2869                 :            :                          GetCurrentCommandId(true), InvalidSnapshot,
    2870                 :            :                          true /* wait for commit */ ,
    2871                 :            :                          &tmfd, false /* changingPart */ );
    2872   [ -  +  -  -  :       2922 :     switch (result)
                      - ]
    2873                 :            :     {
    2874                 :            :         case TM_SelfModified:
    2875                 :            :             /* Tuple was already updated in current command? */
    2876                 :          0 :             elog(ERROR, "tuple already updated by self");
    2877                 :            :             break;
    2878                 :            : 
    2879                 :            :         case TM_Ok:
    2880                 :            :             /* done successfully */
    2881                 :       2922 :             break;
    2882                 :            : 
    2883                 :            :         case TM_Updated:
    2884                 :          0 :             elog(ERROR, "tuple concurrently updated");
    2885                 :            :             break;
    2886                 :            : 
    2887                 :            :         case TM_Deleted:
    2888                 :          0 :             elog(ERROR, "tuple concurrently deleted");
    2889                 :            :             break;
    2890                 :            : 
    2891                 :            :         default:
    2892                 :          0 :             elog(ERROR, "unrecognized heap_delete status: %u", result);
    2893                 :            :             break;
    2894                 :            :     }
    2895                 :       2922 : }
    2896                 :            : 
    2897                 :            : /*
    2898                 :            :  *  heap_update - replace a tuple
    2899                 :            :  *
    2900                 :            :  * See table_tuple_update() for an explanation of the parameters, except that
    2901                 :            :  * this routine directly takes a tuple rather than a slot.
    2902                 :            :  *
    2903                 :            :  * In the failure cases, the routine fills *tmfd with the tuple's t_ctid,
    2904                 :            :  * t_xmax (resolving a possible MultiXact, if necessary), and t_cmax (the last
    2905                 :            :  * only for TM_SelfModified, since we cannot obtain cmax from a combocid
    2906                 :            :  * generated by another transaction).
    2907                 :            :  */
    2908                 :            : TM_Result
    2909                 :     525068 : heap_update(Relation relation, ItemPointer otid, HeapTuple newtup,
    2910                 :            :             CommandId cid, Snapshot crosscheck, bool wait,
    2911                 :            :             TM_FailureData *tmfd, LockTupleMode *lockmode)
    2912                 :            : {
    2913                 :            :     TM_Result   result;
    2914                 :     525068 :     TransactionId xid = GetCurrentTransactionId();
    2915                 :            :     Bitmapset  *hot_attrs;

    2917                 :            :     Bitmapset  *id_attrs;

    2919                 :            :     Bitmapset  *modified_attrs;

    2929                 :            :                 newbuf,
    2930                 :     525068 :                 vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer,
    2931                 :     525068 :                 vmbuffer_new = InvalidBuffer;
    2932                 :            :     bool        need_toast;
    2933                 :            :     Size        newtupsize,
    2934                 :            :                 pagefree;
    2935                 :     525068 :     bool        have_tuple_lock = false;
    2936                 :            :     bool        iscombo;

    2945                 :            :                 xmax_old_tuple;
    2946                 :            :     uint16      infomask_old_tuple,
    2947                 :            :                 infomask2_old_tuple,
    2948                 :            :                 infomask_new_tuple,
    2949                 :            :                 infomask2_new_tuple;
    2950                 :            : 
    2951                 :            :     Assert(ItemPointerIsValid(otid));
    2952                 :            : 
    2953                 :            :     /* Cheap, simplistic check that the tuple matches the rel's rowtype. */
    2954                 :            :     Assert(HeapTupleHeaderGetNatts(newtup->t_data) <=
    2955                 :            :            RelationGetNumberOfAttributes(relation));
    2956                 :            : 
    2957                 :            :     /*
    2958                 :            :      * Forbid this during a parallel operation, lest it allocate a combocid.
    2959                 :            :      * Other workers might need that combocid for visibility checks, and we
    2960                 :            :      * have no provision for broadcasting it to them.
    2961                 :            :      */
    2962         [ -  + ]:     525068 :     if (IsInParallelMode())
    2963         [ #  # ]:          0 :         ereport(ERROR,
    2964                 :            :                 (errcode(ERRCODE_INVALID_TRANSACTION_STATE),
    2965                 :            :                  errmsg("cannot update tuples during a parallel operation")));
    2966                 :            : 
    2967                 :            :     /*
    2968                 :            :      * Fetch the list of attributes to be checked for various operations.
    2969                 :            :      *
    2970                 :            :      * For HOT considerations, this is wasted effort if we fail to update or
    2971                 :            :      * have to put the new tuple on a different page.  But we must compute the
    2972                 :            :      * list before obtaining buffer lock --- in the worst case, if we are
    2973                 :            :      * doing an update on one of the relevant system catalogs, we could
    2974                 :            :      * deadlock if we try to fetch the list later.  In any case, the relcache
    2975                 :            :      * caches the data so this is usually pretty cheap.
    2976                 :            :      *
    2977                 :            :      * We also need columns used by the replica identity and columns that are
    2978                 :            :      * considered the "key" of rows in the table.
    2979                 :            :      *
    2980                 :            :      * Note that we get copies of each bitmap, so we need not worry about
    2981                 :            :      * relcache flush happening midway through.
    2982                 :            :      */
    2983                 :     525068 :     hot_attrs = RelationGetIndexAttrBitmap(relation, INDEX_ATTR_BITMAP_ALL);
    2984                 :     525068 :     key_attrs = RelationGetIndexAttrBitmap(relation, INDEX_ATTR_BITMAP_KEY);
    2985                 :     525068 :     id_attrs = RelationGetIndexAttrBitmap(relation,
    2986                 :            :                                           INDEX_ATTR_BITMAP_IDENTITY_KEY);
    2987                 :            : 
    2988                 :            : 
    2989                 :     525068 :     block = ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(otid);
    2990                 :     525068 :     buffer = ReadBuffer(relation, block);
    2991         [ -  + ]:     525068 :     page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    2992                 :            : 
    2993                 :     525068 :     interesting_attrs = NULL;
    2994                 :            : 
    2995                 :            :     /*
    2996                 :            :      * If the page is already full, there is hardly any chance of doing a HOT
    2997                 :            :      * update on this page. It might be wasteful effort to look for index
    2998                 :            :      * column updates only to later reject HOT updates for lack of space in
    2999                 :            :      * the same page. So we be conservative and only fetch hot_attrs if the
    3000                 :            :      * page is not already full. Since we are already holding a pin on the
    3001                 :            :      * buffer, there is no chance that the buffer can get cleaned up
    3002                 :            :      * concurrently and even if that was possible, in the worst case we lose a
    3003                 :            :      * chance to do a HOT update.
    3004                 :            :      */
    3005         [ +  + ]:     525068 :     if (!PageIsFull(page))
    3006                 :            :     {

    3018                 :            :      */

    3043                 :            :     /*
    3044                 :            :      * If we're not updating any "key" column, we can grab a weaker lock type.
    3045                 :            :      * This allows for more concurrency when we are running simultaneously
    3046                 :            :      * with foreign key checks.
    3047                 :            :      *
    3048                 :            :      * Note that if a column gets detoasted while executing the update, but
    3049                 :            :      * the value ends up being the same, this test will fail and we will use
    3050                 :            :      * the stronger lock.  This is acceptable; the important case to optimize
    3051                 :            :      * is updates that don't manipulate key columns, not those that
    3052                 :            :      * serendipitiously arrive at the same key values.
    3053                 :            :      */

    3061                 :            :          * If this is the first possibly-multixact-able operation in the

    3063                 :            :          * setting. We can be certain that the transaction will never become a
    3064                 :            :          * member of any older MultiXactIds than that.  (We have to do this
    3065                 :            :          * even if we end up just using our own TransactionId below, since
    3066                 :            :          * some other backend could incorporate our XID into a MultiXact

    3106                 :            :         /*

    3108                 :            :          * isn't a problem currently because no caller uses that case, but it
    3109                 :            :          * should be fixed if such a caller is introduced.  It wasn't a
    3110                 :            :          * problem previously because this code would always wait, but now
    3111                 :            :          * that some tuple locks do not conflict with one of the lock modes we
    3112                 :            :          * use, it is possible that this case is interesting to handle
    3113                 :            :          * specially.
    3114                 :            :          *
    3115                 :            :          * This may cause failures with third-party code that calls

    3118                 :            : 
    3119                 :            :         /* must copy state data before unlocking buffer */
    3120                 :     237933 :         xwait = HeapTupleHeaderGetRawXmax(oldtup.t_data);
    3121                 :     237933 :         infomask = oldtup.t_data->t_infomask;
    3122                 :            : 
    3123                 :            :         /*
    3124                 :            :          * Now we have to do something about the existing locker.  If it's a
    3125                 :            :          * multi, sleep on it; we might be awakened before it is completely
    3126                 :            :          * gone (or even not sleep at all in some cases); we need to preserve
    3127                 :            :          * it as locker, unless it is gone completely.
    3128                 :            :          *
    3129                 :            :          * If it's not a multi, we need to check for sleeping conditions
    3130                 :            :          * before actually going to sleep.  If the update doesn't conflict
    3131                 :            :          * with the locks, we just continue without sleeping (but making sure
    3132                 :            :          * it is preserved).
    3133                 :            :          *
    3134                 :            :          * Before sleeping, we need to acquire tuple lock to establish our
    3135                 :            :          * priority for the tuple (see heap_lock_tuple).  LockTuple will
    3136                 :            :          * release us when we are next-in-line for the tuple.  Note we must
    3137                 :            :          * not acquire the tuple lock until we're sure we're going to sleep;
    3138                 :            :          * otherwise we're open for race conditions with other transactions
    3139                 :            :          * holding the tuple lock which sleep on us.
    3140                 :            :          *
    3141                 :            :          * If we are forced to "start over" below, we keep the tuple lock;
    3142                 :            :          * this arranges that we stay at the head of the line while rechecking
    3143                 :            :          * tuple state.
    3144                 :            :          */
    3145         [ +  + ]:     237933 :         if (infomask & HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI)

    3190                 :            :              * careful to mark the updated tuple with the surviving members in

    3193                 :            :              * Note that there could have been another update in the

    3195                 :            :              * or aborted. If it aborted we are safe to update it again;

    3384                 :            : 
    3385                 :            :     /*
    3386                 :            :      * Prepare the new tuple with the appropriate initial values of Xmin and
    3387                 :            :      * Xmax, as well as initial infomask bits as computed above.
    3388                 :            :      */

    3403                 :            :     /*

    3405                 :            :      * on the same page as the old, then we need to release the content lock

    3407                 :            :      * TOAST and/or table-file-extension work.  We must mark the old tuple to
    3408                 :            :      * show that it's locked, else other processes may try to update it

    3410                 :            :      *

    3436                 :     209808 :         bool        cleared_all_frozen = false;
    3437                 :            : 
    3438                 :            :         /*
    3439                 :            :          * To prevent concurrent sessions from updating the tuple, we have to
    3440                 :            :          * temporarily mark it locked, while we release the page-level lock.
    3441                 :            :          *
    3442                 :            :          * To satisfy the rule that any xid potentially appearing in a buffer
    3443                 :            :          * written out to disk, we unfortunately have to WAL log this
    3444                 :            :          * temporary modification.  We can reuse xl_heap_lock for this
    3445                 :            :          * purpose.  If we crash/error before following through with the
    3446                 :            :          * actual update, xmax will be of an aborted transaction, allowing
    3447                 :            :          * other sessions to proceed.

    3522                 :            :          * data.

    3524         [ +  + ]:     209808 :         if (need_toast)
    3525                 :            :         {
    3526                 :            :             /* Note we always use WAL and FSM during updates */
    3527                 :        288 :             heaptup = toast_insert_or_update(relation, newtup, &oldtup, 0);
    3528                 :        288 :             newtupsize = MAXALIGN(heaptup->t_len);
    3529                 :            :         }
    3530                 :            :         else
    3531                 :     209520 :             heaptup = newtup;
    3532                 :            : 
    3533                 :            :         /*
    3534                 :            :          * Now, do we need a new page for the tuple, or not?  This is a bit
    3535                 :            :          * tricky since someone else could have added tuples to the page while
    3536                 :            :          * we weren't looking.  We have to recheck the available space after
    3537                 :            :          * reacquiring the buffer lock.  But don't bother to do that if the
    3538                 :            :          * former amount of free space is still not enough; it's unlikely
    3539                 :            :          * there's more free now than before.
    3540                 :            :          *
    3541                 :            :          * What's more, if we need to get a new page, we will need to acquire
    3542                 :            :          * buffer locks on both old and new pages.  To avoid deadlock against
    3543                 :            :          * some other backend trying to get the same two locks in the other
    3544                 :            :          * order, we must be consistent about the order we get the locks in.
    3545                 :            :          * We use the rule "lock the lower-numbered page of the relation
    3546                 :            :          * first".  To implement this, we must do RelationGetBufferForTuple
    3547                 :            :          * while not holding the lock on the old page, and we must rely on it
    3548                 :            :          * to get the locks on both pages in the correct order.
    3549                 :            :          *
    3550                 :            :          * Another consideration is that we need visibility map page pin(s) if
    3551                 :            :          * we will have to clear the all-visible flag on either page.  If we
    3552                 :            :          * call RelationGetBufferForTuple, we rely on it to acquire any such
    3553                 :            :          * pins; but if we don't, we have to handle that here.  Hence we need
    3554                 :            :          * a loop.
    3555                 :            :          */
    3556                 :            :         for (;;)
    3557                 :            :         {
    3558         [ +  + ]:     209808 :             if (newtupsize > pagefree)
    3559                 :            :             {

    3562                 :            :                                                    buffer, 0, NULL,
    3563                 :            :                                                    &vmbuffer_new, &vmbuffer);
    3564                 :            :                 /* We're all done. */
    3565                 :     209696 :                 break;
    3566                 :            :             }
    3567                 :            :             /* Acquire VM page pin if needed and we don't have it. */
    3568 [ +  - ][ -  + ]:        112 :             if (vmbuffer == InvalidBuffer && PageIsAllVisible(page))

    3601                 :            :      * avoid possibly having to roll back work we've just done.
    3602                 :            :      *
    3603                 :            :      * This is safe without a recheck as long as there is no possibility of
    3604                 :            :      * another process scanning the pages between this check and the update
    3605                 :            :      * being visible to the scan (i.e., exclusive buffer content lock(s) are
    3606                 :            :      * continuously held from this point until the tuple update is visible).
    3607                 :            :      *

    3970                 :            : 
    3971                 :            : /*
    3972                 :            :  *  heap_lock_tuple - lock a tuple in shared or exclusive mode
    3973                 :            :  *
    3974                 :            :  * Note that this acquires a buffer pin, which the caller must release.
    3975                 :            :  *
    3976                 :            :  * Input parameters:
    3977                 :            :  *  relation: relation containing tuple (caller must hold suitable lock)
    3978                 :            :  *  tid: TID of tuple to lock
    3979                 :            :  *  cid: current command ID (used for visibility test, and stored into
    3980                 :            :  *      tuple's cmax if lock is successful)
    3981                 :            :  *  mode: indicates if shared or exclusive tuple lock is desired
    3982                 :            :  *  wait_policy: what to do if tuple lock is not available
    3983                 :            :  *  follow_updates: if true, follow the update chain to also lock descendant
    3984                 :            :  *      tuples.
    3985                 :            :  *
    3986                 :            :  * Output parameters:
    3987                 :            :  *  *tuple: all fields filled in
    3988                 :            :  *  *buffer: set to buffer holding tuple (pinned but not locked at exit)
    3989                 :            :  *  *tmfd: filled in failure cases (see below)
    3990                 :            :  *
    3991                 :            :  * Function results are the same as the ones for table_tuple_lock().
    3992                 :            :  *
    3993                 :            :  * In the failure cases other than TM_Invisible, the routine fills
    3994                 :            :  * *tmfd with the tuple's t_ctid, t_xmax (resolving a possible MultiXact,
    3995                 :            :  * if necessary), and t_cmax (the last only for TM_SelfModified,
    3996                 :            :  * since we cannot obtain cmax from a combocid generated by another
    3997                 :            :  * transaction).
    3998                 :            :  * See comments for struct TM_FailureData for additional info.
    3999                 :            :  *
    4000                 :            :  * See README.tuplock for a thorough explanation of this mechanism.
    4001                 :            :  */
    4002                 :            : TM_Result
    4003                 :   54771775 : heap_lock_tuple(Relation relation, HeapTuple tuple,
    4004                 :            :                 CommandId cid, LockTupleMode mode, LockWaitPolicy wait_policy,
    4005                 :            :                 bool follow_updates,
    4006                 :            :                 Buffer *buffer, TM_FailureData *tmfd)
    4007                 :            : {
    4008                 :            :     TM_Result   result;
    4009                 :   54771775 :     ItemPointer tid = &(tuple->t_self);
    4010                 :            :     ItemId      lp;
    4011                 :            :     Page        page;
    4012                 :   54771775 :     Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    4013                 :            :     BlockNumber block;
    4014                 :            :     TransactionId xid,
    4015                 :            :                 xmax;
    4016                 :            :     uint16      old_infomask,
    4017                 :            :                 new_infomask,
    4018                 :            :                 new_infomask2;

    4024                 :   54771775 :     *buffer = ReadBuffer(relation, ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(tid));

    4027                 :            :     /*

    4030                 :            :      * in the middle of changing this, so we'll need to recheck after we have
    4031                 :            :      * the lock.

    4033 [ -  + ][ +  + ]:   54771775 :     if (PageIsAllVisible(BufferGetPage(*buffer)))

    4061         [ -  + ]:   22090495 :              result == TM_Updated ||
    4062                 :            :              result == TM_Deleted)
    4063                 :            :     {
    4064                 :            :         TransactionId xwait;
    4065                 :            :         uint16      infomask;

    4067                 :            :         bool        require_sleep;
    4068                 :            :         ItemPointerData t_ctid;
    4069                 :            : 
    4070                 :            :         /* must copy state data before unlocking buffer */
    4071                 :   32704495 :         xwait = HeapTupleHeaderGetRawXmax(tuple->t_data);
    4072                 :   32704495 :         infomask = tuple->t_data->t_infomask;
    4073                 :   32704495 :         infomask2 = tuple->t_data->t_infomask2;
    4074                 :   32704495 :         ItemPointerCopy(&tuple->t_data->t_ctid, &t_ctid);
    4075                 :            : 
    4076                 :   32704495 :         LockBuffer(*buffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    4077                 :            : 
    4078                 :            :         /*
    4079                 :            :          * If any subtransaction of the current top transaction already holds
    4080                 :            :          * a lock as strong as or stronger than what we're requesting, we
    4081                 :            :          * effectively hold the desired lock already.  We *must* succeed
    4082                 :            :          * without trying to take the tuple lock, else we will deadlock
    4083                 :            :          * against anyone wanting to acquire a stronger lock.
    4084                 :            :          *
    4085                 :            :          * Note we only do this the first time we loop on the HTSU result;
    4086                 :            :          * there is no point in testing in subsequent passes, because
    4087                 :            :          * evidently our own transaction cannot have acquired a new lock after
    4088                 :            :          * the first time we checked.
    4089                 :            :          */
    4090         [ +  + ]:   32704495 :         if (first_time)
    4091                 :            :         {
    4092                 :   32683554 :             first_time = false;
    4093                 :            : 
    4094         [ +  + ]:   32683554 :             if (infomask & HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI)

    4104                 :            :                  */
    4105                 :   24090291 :                 nmembers =

    4107 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:   24090291 :                                           HEAP_XMAX_IS_LOCKED_ONLY(infomask));

    4109         [ +  + ]:  206873831 :                 for (i = 0; i < nmembers; i++)

    4111                 :            :                     /* only consider members of our own transaction */
    4112         [ +  + ]:  187868865 :                     if (!TransactionIdIsCurrentTransactionId(members[i].xid))
    4113                 :  182735515 :                         continue;
    4114                 :            : 
    4115         [ +  + ]:    5133350 :                     if (TUPLOCK_from_mxstatus(members[i].status) >= mode)
    4116                 :            :                     {
    4117                 :    5085325 :                         pfree(members);
    4118                 :    5085325 :                         result = TM_Ok;
    4119                 :    5085325 :                         goto out_unlocked;
    4120                 :            :                     }
    4121                 :            :                     else
    4122                 :            :                     {
    4123                 :            :                         /*
    4124                 :            :                          * Disable acquisition of the heavyweight tuple lock.
    4125                 :            :                          * Otherwise, when promoting a weaker lock, we might
    4126                 :            :                          * deadlock with another locker that has acquired the
    4127                 :            :                          * heavyweight tuple lock and is waiting for our
    4128                 :            :                          * transaction to finish.
    4129                 :            :                          *

    4131                 :            :                          * the multixact if required, to avoid acquiring
    4132                 :            :                          * conflicting locks.

    4148                 :            :                                HEAP_XMAX_IS_EXCL_LOCKED(infomask));

    4150                 :     367936 :                         goto out_unlocked;

    4153                 :     961354 :                             HEAP_XMAX_IS_EXCL_LOCKED(infomask))
    4154                 :            :                         {
