    6626         [ +  + ]:    1951221 :             if (!DoLockModesConflict(memlockmode, wanted))
    6627                 :    1764305 :                 continue;

    6630                 :            :             {

    6644                 :            :              * wanted lock, and updaters that are not aborted.  Those conflict
    6645                 :            :              * with what we want.  Set up to return true, but keep going to
    6646                 :            :              * look for the current transaction among the multixact members,
    6647                 :            :              * if needed.
    6648                 :            :              */

    6650                 :            :         }
    6651                 :     384153 :         pfree(members);
    6652                 :            :     }
    6653                 :            : 
    6654                 :     384153 :     return result;
    6655                 :            : }
    6656                 :            : 
    6657                 :            : /*
    6658                 :            :  * Do_MultiXactIdWait
    6659                 :            :  *      Actual implementation for the two functions below.
    6660                 :            :  *
    6661                 :            :  * 'multi', 'status' and 'infomask' indicate what to sleep on (the status is
    6662                 :            :  * needed to ensure we only sleep on conflicting members, and the infomask is
    6663                 :            :  * used to optimize multixact access in case it's a lock-only multi); 'nowait'
    6664                 :            :  * indicates whether to use conditional lock acquisition, to allow callers to
    6665                 :            :  * fail if lock is unavailable.  'rel', 'ctid' and 'oper' are used to set up
    6666                 :            :  * context information for error messages.  'remaining', if not NULL, receives
    6667                 :            :  * the number of members that are still running, including any (non-aborted)
    6668                 :            :  * subtransactions of our own transaction.
    6669                 :            :  *
    6670                 :            :  * We do this by sleeping on each member using XactLockTableWait.  Any
    6671                 :            :  * members that belong to the current backend are *not* waited for, however;
    6672                 :            :  * this would not merely be useless but would lead to Assert failure inside
    6673                 :            :  * XactLockTableWait.  By the time this returns, it is certain that all
    6674                 :            :  * transactions *of other backends* that were members of the MultiXactId
    6675                 :            :  * that conflict with the requested status are dead (and no new ones can have
    6676                 :            :  * been added, since it is not legal to add members to an existing
    6677                 :            :  * MultiXactId).
    6678                 :            :  *
    6679                 :            :  * But by the time we finish sleeping, someone else may have changed the Xmax
    6680                 :            :  * of the containing tuple, so the caller needs to iterate on us somehow.
    6681                 :            :  *
    6682                 :            :  * Note that in case we return false, the number of remaining members is
    6683                 :            :  * not to be trusted.
    6684                 :            :  */
    6685                 :            : static bool
    6686                 :      90382 : Do_MultiXactIdWait(MultiXactId multi, MultiXactStatus status,
    6687                 :            :                    uint16 infomask, bool nowait,
    6688                 :            :                    Relation rel, ItemPointer ctid, XLTW_Oper oper,
    6689                 :            :                    int *remaining)
    6690                 :            : {
    6691                 :      90382 :     bool        result = true;
    6692                 :            :     MultiXactMember *members;
    6693                 :            :     int         nmembers;
    6694                 :      90382 :     int         remain = 0;
    6695                 :            : 
    6696                 :            :     /* for pre-pg_upgrade tuples, no need to sleep at all */

    6752                 :            : 
    6753                 :            : /*
    6754                 :            :  * MultiXactIdWait
    6755                 :            :  *      Sleep on a MultiXactId.
    6756                 :            :  *
    6757                 :            :  * By the time we finish sleeping, someone else may have changed the Xmax
    6758                 :            :  * of the containing tuple, so the caller needs to iterate on us somehow.
    6759                 :            :  *
    6760                 :            :  * We return (in *remaining, if not NULL) the number of members that are still
    6761                 :            :  * running, including any (non-aborted) subtransactions of our own transaction.
    6762                 :            :  */
    6763                 :            : static void
    6764                 :      90382 : MultiXactIdWait(MultiXactId multi, MultiXactStatus status, uint16 infomask,
    6765                 :            :                 Relation rel, ItemPointer ctid, XLTW_Oper oper,
    6766                 :            :                 int *remaining)
    6767                 :            : {
    6768                 :      90382 :     (void) Do_MultiXactIdWait(multi, status, infomask, false,
    6769                 :            :                               rel, ctid, oper, remaining);
    6770                 :      78817 : }
    6771                 :            : 
    6772                 :            : /*
    6773                 :            :  * ConditionalMultiXactIdWait
    6774                 :            :  *      As above, but only lock if we can get the lock without blocking.
    6775                 :            :  *
    6776                 :            :  * By the time we finish sleeping, someone else may have changed the Xmax
    6777                 :            :  * of the containing tuple, so the caller needs to iterate on us somehow.
    6778                 :            :  *
    6779                 :            :  * If the multixact is now all gone, return true.  Returns false if some
    6780                 :            :  * transactions might still be running.
    6781                 :            :  *
    6782                 :            :  * We return (in *remaining, if not NULL) the number of members that are still
    6783                 :            :  * running, including any (non-aborted) subtransactions of our own transaction.
    6784                 :            :  */
    6785                 :            : static bool
    6786                 :          0 : ConditionalMultiXactIdWait(MultiXactId multi, MultiXactStatus status,

    6793                 :            : /*
    6794                 :            :  * heap_tuple_needs_eventual_freeze
    6795                 :            :  *
    6796                 :            :  * Check to see whether any of the XID fields of a tuple (xmin, xmax, xvac)
    6797                 :            :  * will eventually require freezing.  Similar to heap_tuple_needs_freeze,
    6798                 :            :  * but there's no cutoff, since we're trying to figure out whether freezing
    6799                 :            :  * will ever be needed, not whether it's needed now.

    6842                 :            : /*
    6843                 :            :  * heap_tuple_needs_freeze
    6844                 :            :  *
    6845                 :            :  * Check to see whether any of the XID fields of a tuple (xmin, xmax, xvac)
    6846                 :            :  * are older than the specified cutoff XID or MultiXactId.  If so, return true.
    6847                 :            :  *
    6848                 :            :  * It doesn't matter whether the tuple is alive or dead, we are checking
    6849                 :            :  * to see if a tuple needs to be removed or frozen to avoid wraparound.
    6850                 :            :  *

    6852                 :            :  * on a standby.

    6925                 :            : 
    6926                 :            : /*
    6927                 :            :  * If 'tuple' contains any visible XID greater than latestRemovedXid,
    6928                 :            :  * ratchet forwards latestRemovedXid to the greatest one found.
    6929                 :            :  * This is used as the basis for generating Hot Standby conflicts, so
    6930                 :            :  * if a tuple was never visible then removing it should not conflict
    6931                 :            :  * with queries.
    6932                 :            :  */
    6933                 :            : void
    6934                 :     499680 : HeapTupleHeaderAdvanceLatestRemovedXid(HeapTupleHeader tuple,
    6935                 :            :                                        TransactionId *latestRemovedXid)
    6936                 :            : {
    6937         [ +  + ]:     499680 :     TransactionId xmin = HeapTupleHeaderGetXmin(tuple);
    6938 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:     499680 :     TransactionId xmax = HeapTupleHeaderGetUpdateXid(tuple);
                 [ +  + ]
    6939         [ -  + ]:     499680 :     TransactionId xvac = HeapTupleHeaderGetXvac(tuple);
    6940                 :            : 
    6941         [ -  + ]:     499680 :     if (tuple->t_infomask & HEAP_MOVED)
    6942                 :            :     {
    6943         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (TransactionIdPrecedes(*latestRemovedXid, xvac))
    6944                 :          0 :             *latestRemovedXid = xvac;
    6945                 :            :     }
    6946                 :            : 
    6947                 :            :     /*
    6948                 :            :      * Ignore tuples inserted by an aborted transaction or if the tuple was
    6949                 :            :      * updated/deleted by the inserting transaction.
    6950                 :            :      *
    6951                 :            :      * Look for a committed hint bit, or if no xmin bit is set, check clog.
    6952                 :            :      * This needs to work on both master and standby, where it is used to
    6953                 :            :      * assess btree delete records.
    6954                 :            :      */
    6955 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:     499680 :     if (HeapTupleHeaderXminCommitted(tuple) ||
    6956         [ #  # ]:          0 :         (!HeapTupleHeaderXminInvalid(tuple) && TransactionIdDidCommit(xmin)))
    6957                 :            :     {
    6958   [ +  +  +  + ]:     352522 :         if (xmax != xmin &&
    6959                 :     173283 :             TransactionIdFollows(xmax, *latestRemovedXid))

    6962                 :            :

    6964                 :     499680 : }
    6965                 :            : 
    6966                 :            : #ifdef USE_PREFETCH
    6967                 :            : /*
    6968                 :            :  * Helper function for heap_compute_xid_horizon_for_tuples.  Issue prefetch
    6969                 :            :  * requests for the number of buffers indicated by prefetch_count.  The
    6970                 :            :  * prefetch_state keeps track of all the buffers that we can prefetch and
    6971                 :            :  * which ones have already been prefetched; each call to this function picks
    6972                 :            :  * up where the previous call left off.
    6973                 :            :  */
    6974                 :            : static void
    6975                 :     123518 : xid_horizon_prefetch_buffer(Relation rel,
    6976                 :            :                             XidHorizonPrefetchState *prefetch_state,
    6977                 :            :                             int prefetch_count)
    6978                 :            : {
    6979                 :     123518 :     BlockNumber cur_hblkno = prefetch_state->cur_hblkno;
    6980                 :     123518 :     int         count = 0;
    6981                 :            :     int         i;
    6982                 :     123518 :     int         nitems = prefetch_state->nitems;
    6983                 :     123518 :     ItemPointerData *tids = prefetch_state->tids;
    6984                 :            : 
    6985         [ +  + ]:     443052 :     for (i = prefetch_state->next_item;
    6986         [ +  + ]:     368862 :          i < nitems && count < prefetch_count;
    6987                 :     319534 :          i++)
    6988                 :            :     {
    6989                 :     319534 :         ItemPointer htid = &tids[i];
    6990                 :            : 
    6991 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:     319534 :         if (cur_hblkno == InvalidBlockNumber ||
    6992                 :     310484 :             ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(htid) != cur_hblkno)
    6993                 :            :         {
    6994                 :     114468 :             cur_hblkno = ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(htid);
    6995                 :     114468 :             PrefetchBuffer(rel, MAIN_FORKNUM, cur_hblkno);
    6996                 :     114468 :             count++;
    6997                 :            :         }
    6998                 :            :     }
    6999                 :            : 
    7000                 :            :     /*
    7001                 :            :      * Save the prefetch position so that next time we can continue from that
    7002                 :            :      * position.
    7003                 :            :      */
    7004                 :     123518 :     prefetch_state->next_item = i;
    7005                 :     123518 :     prefetch_state->cur_hblkno = cur_hblkno;
    7006                 :     123518 : }
    7007                 :            : #endif
    7008                 :            : 
    7009                 :            : /*
    7010                 :            :  * Get the latestRemovedXid from the heap pages pointed at by the index
    7011                 :            :  * tuples being deleted.
    7012                 :            :  *
    7013                 :            :  * We used to do this during recovery rather than on the primary, but that
    7014                 :            :  * approach now appears inferior.  It meant that the master could generate
    7015                 :            :  * a lot of work for the standby without any back-pressure to slow down the
    7016                 :            :  * master, and it required the standby to have reached consistency, whereas
    7017                 :            :  * we want to have correct information available even before that point.
    7018                 :            :  *
    7019                 :            :  * It's possible for this to generate a fair amount of I/O, since we may be
    7020                 :            :  * deleting hundreds of tuples from a single index block.  To amortize that
    7021                 :            :  * cost to some degree, this uses prefetching and combines repeat accesses to
    7022                 :            :  * the same block.
    7023                 :            :  */
    7024                 :            : TransactionId
    7025                 :       9050 : heap_compute_xid_horizon_for_tuples(Relation rel,
    7026                 :            :                                     ItemPointerData *tids,
    7027                 :            :                                     int nitems)
    7028                 :            : {
    7029                 :            :     /* Initial assumption is that earlier pruning took care of conflict */
    7030                 :       9050 :     TransactionId latestRemovedXid = InvalidTransactionId;
    7031                 :       9050 :     BlockNumber blkno = InvalidBlockNumber;
    7032                 :       9050 :     Buffer      buf = InvalidBuffer;
    7033                 :       9050 :     Page        page = NULL;
    7034                 :       9050 :     OffsetNumber maxoff = InvalidOffsetNumber;
    7035                 :            :     TransactionId priorXmax;
    7036                 :            : #ifdef USE_PREFETCH
    7037                 :            :     XidHorizonPrefetchState prefetch_state;
    7038                 :            :     int         io_concurrency;
    7039                 :            :     int         prefetch_distance;
    7040                 :            : #endif
    7041                 :            : 
    7042                 :            :     /*
    7043                 :            :      * Sort to avoid repeated lookups for the same page, and to make it more
    7044                 :            :      * likely to access items in an efficient order. In particular, this
    7045                 :            :      * ensures that if there are multiple pointers to the same page, they all
    7046                 :            :      * get processed looking up and locking the page just once.
    7047                 :            :      */
    7048                 :       9050 :     qsort((void *) tids, nitems, sizeof(ItemPointerData),
    7049                 :            :           (int (*) (const void *, const void *)) ItemPointerCompare);
    7050                 :            : 
    7051                 :            : #ifdef USE_PREFETCH
    7052                 :            :     /* Initialize prefetch state. */
    7053                 :       9050 :     prefetch_state.cur_hblkno = InvalidBlockNumber;
    7054                 :       9050 :     prefetch_state.next_item = 0;
    7055                 :       9050 :     prefetch_state.nitems = nitems;
    7056                 :       9050 :     prefetch_state.tids = tids;
    7057                 :            : 
    7058                 :            :     /*
    7059                 :            :      * Compute the prefetch distance that we will attempt to maintain.
    7060                 :            :      *
    7061                 :            :      * We don't use the regular formula to determine how much to prefetch
    7062                 :            :      * here, but instead just add a constant to effective_io_concurrency.
    7063                 :            :      * That's because it seems best to do some prefetching here even when
    7064                 :            :      * effective_io_concurrency is set to 0, but if the DBA thinks it's OK to
    7065                 :            :      * do more prefetching for other operations, then it's probably OK to do
    7066                 :            :      * more prefetching in this case, too. It may be that this formula is too
    7067                 :            :      * simplistic, but at the moment there is no evidence of that or any idea
    7068                 :            :      * about what would work better.
    7069                 :            :      *
    7070                 :            :      * Since the caller holds a buffer lock somewhere in rel, we'd better make
    7071                 :            :      * sure that isn't a catalog relation before we call code that does
    7072                 :            :      * syscache lookups, to avoid risk of deadlock.
    7073                 :            :      */
    7074         [ +  + ]:       9050 :     if (IsCatalogRelation(rel))
    7075                 :          9 :         io_concurrency = effective_io_concurrency;
    7076                 :            :     else
    7077                 :       9041 :         io_concurrency = get_tablespace_io_concurrency(rel->rd_rel->reltablespace);
    7078                 :       9050 :     prefetch_distance = Min((io_concurrency) + 10, MAX_IO_CONCURRENCY);
    7079                 :            : 
    7080                 :            :     /* Start prefetching. */
    7081                 :       9050 :     xid_horizon_prefetch_buffer(rel, &prefetch_state, prefetch_distance);
    7082                 :            : #endif
    7083                 :            : 
    7084                 :            :     /* Iterate over all tids, and check their horizon */
    7085         [ +  + ]:     328584 :     for (int i = 0; i < nitems; i++)
    7086                 :            :     {
    7087                 :     319534 :         ItemPointer htid = &tids[i];
    7088                 :            :         OffsetNumber offnum;
    7089                 :            : 
    7090                 :            :         /*
    7091                 :            :          * Read heap buffer, but avoid refetching if it's the same block as
    7092                 :            :          * required for the last tid.
    7093                 :            :          */
    7094 [ +  + ][ +  + ]:     319534 :         if (blkno == InvalidBlockNumber ||
    7095                 :     310484 :             ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(htid) != blkno)
    7096                 :            :         {
    7097                 :            :             /* release old buffer */
    7098         [ +  + ]:     114468 :             if (BufferIsValid(buf))
    7099                 :            :             {
    7100                 :     105418 :                 LockBuffer(buf, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    7101                 :     105418 :                 ReleaseBuffer(buf);
    7102                 :            :             }
    7103                 :            : 
    7104                 :     114468 :             blkno = ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(htid);
    7105                 :            : 
    7106                 :     114468 :             buf = ReadBuffer(rel, blkno);
    7107                 :            : 
    7108                 :            : #ifdef USE_PREFETCH
    7109                 :            : 
    7110                 :            :             /*
    7111                 :            :              * To maintain the prefetch distance, prefetch one more page for
    7112                 :            :              * each page we read.
    7113                 :            :              */
    7114                 :     114468 :             xid_horizon_prefetch_buffer(rel, &prefetch_state, 1);
    7115                 :            : #endif
    7116                 :            : 
    7117                 :     114468 :             LockBuffer(buf, BUFFER_LOCK_SHARE);
    7118                 :            : 
    7119         [ -  + ]:     114468 :             page = BufferGetPage(buf);
    7120         [ +  + ]:     114468 :             maxoff = PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page);
    7121                 :            :         }
    7122                 :            : 
    7123                 :            :         /*
    7124                 :            :          * Maintain latestRemovedXid value for deletion operation as a whole
    7125                 :            :          * by advancing current value using heap tuple headers.  This is
    7126                 :            :          * loosely based on the logic for pruning a HOT chain.
    7127                 :            :          */
    7128                 :     319534 :         offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(htid);
    7129                 :     319534 :         priorXmax = InvalidTransactionId;   /* cannot check first XMIN */
    7130                 :            :         for (;;)
    7131                 :            :         {
    7132                 :            :             ItemId      lp;
    7133                 :            :             HeapTupleHeader htup;
    7134                 :            : 
    7135                 :            :             /* Some sanity checks */
    7136 [ +  - ][ +  + ]:     319718 :             if (offnum < FirstOffsetNumber || offnum > maxoff)
    7137                 :            :             {
    7138                 :            :                 Assert(false);
    7139                 :         96 :                 break;
    7140                 :            :             }
    7141                 :            : 
    7142                 :     319622 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    7143         [ +  + ]:     319622 :             if (ItemIdIsRedirected(lp))
    7144                 :            :             {
    7145                 :         62 :                 offnum = ItemIdGetRedirect(lp);
    7146                 :         62 :                 continue;
    7147                 :            :             }
    7148                 :            : 
    7149                 :            :             /*
    7150                 :            :              * We'll often encounter LP_DEAD line pointers.  No need to do
    7151                 :            :              * anything more with htid when that happens.  This is okay
    7152                 :            :              * because the earlier pruning operation that made the line
    7153                 :            :              * pointer LP_DEAD in the first place must have considered the
    7154                 :            :              * tuple header as part of generating its own latestRemovedXid
    7155                 :            :              * value.
    7156                 :            :              *
    7157                 :            :              * Relying on XLOG_HEAP2_CLEANUP_INFO records like this is the
    7158                 :            :              * same strategy that index vacuuming uses in all cases.  Index
    7159                 :            :              * VACUUM WAL records don't even have a latestRemovedXid field of
    7160                 :            :              * their own for this reason.
    7161                 :            :              */
    7162         [ +  + ]:     319560 :             if (!ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
    7163                 :     180897 :                 break;
    7164                 :            : 
    7165                 :     138663 :             htup = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    7166                 :            : 
    7167                 :            :             /*
    7168                 :            :              * Check the tuple XMIN against prior XMAX, if any
    7169                 :            :              */
    7170 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:     138785 :             if (TransactionIdIsValid(priorXmax) &&
    7171         [ +  - ]:        122 :                 !TransactionIdEquals(HeapTupleHeaderGetXmin(htup), priorXmax))
    7172                 :          0 :                 break;
    7173                 :            : 
    7174                 :     138663 :             HeapTupleHeaderAdvanceLatestRemovedXid(htup, &latestRemovedXid);
    7175                 :            : 
    7176                 :            :             /*
    7177                 :            :              * If the tuple is not HOT-updated, then we are at the end of this
    7178                 :            :              * HOT-chain.  No need to visit later tuples from the same update
    7179                 :            :              * chain (they get their own index entries) -- just move on to
    7180                 :            :              * next htid from index AM caller.
    7181                 :            :              */
    7182 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:     138663 :             if (!HeapTupleHeaderIsHotUpdated(htup))
                 [ +  + ]
    7183                 :            :                 break;
    7184                 :            : 
    7185                 :            :             /* Advance to next HOT chain member */
    7186                 :            :             Assert(ItemPointerGetBlockNumber(&htup->t_ctid) == blkno);
    7187                 :        122 :             offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&htup->t_ctid);

                 [ #  # ]
    7189                 :        184 :         }
    7190                 :            :     }
    7191                 :            : 
    7192         [ +  - ]:       9050 :     if (BufferIsValid(buf))
    7193                 :            :     {
    7194                 :       9050 :         LockBuffer(buf, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    7195                 :       9050 :         ReleaseBuffer(buf);
    7196                 :            :     }
    7197                 :            : 
    7198                 :       9050 :     return latestRemovedXid;
    7199                 :            : }
    7200                 :            : 
    7201                 :            : /*
    7202                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert to register a heap cleanup info message. These
    7203                 :            :  * messages are sent once per VACUUM and are required because
    7204                 :            :  * of the phasing of removal operations during a lazy VACUUM.
    7205                 :            :  * see comments for vacuum_log_cleanup_info().
    7206                 :            :  */
    7207                 :            : XLogRecPtr
    7208                 :        188 : log_heap_cleanup_info(RelFileNode rnode, TransactionId latestRemovedXid)
    7209                 :            : {
    7210                 :            :     xl_heap_cleanup_info xlrec;
    7211                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  recptr;
    7212                 :            : 
    7213                 :        188 :     xlrec.node = rnode;
    7214                 :        188 :     xlrec.latestRemovedXid = latestRemovedXid;
    7215                 :            : 
    7216                 :        188 :     XLogBeginInsert();
    7217                 :        188 :     XLogRegisterData((char *) &xlrec, SizeOfHeapCleanupInfo);
    7218                 :            : 
    7219                 :        188 :     recptr = XLogInsert(RM_HEAP2_ID, XLOG_HEAP2_CLEANUP_INFO);
    7220                 :            : 
    7221                 :        188 :     return recptr;
    7222                 :            : }
    7223                 :            : 
    7224                 :            : /*
    7225                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert for a heap-clean operation.  Caller must already
    7226                 :            :  * have modified the buffer and marked it dirty.
    7227                 :            :  *
    7228                 :            :  * Note: prior to Postgres 8.3, the entries in the nowunused[] array were
    7229                 :            :  * zero-based tuple indexes.  Now they are one-based like other uses
    7230                 :            :  * of OffsetNumber.
    7231                 :            :  *
    7232                 :            :  * We also include latestRemovedXid, which is the greatest XID present in
    7233                 :            :  * the removed tuples. That allows recovery processing to cancel or wait
    7234                 :            :  * for long standby queries that can still see these tuples.
    7235                 :            :  */
    7236                 :            : XLogRecPtr
    7237                 :      88981 : log_heap_clean(Relation reln, Buffer buffer,
    7238                 :            :                OffsetNumber *redirected, int nredirected,
    7239                 :            :                OffsetNumber *nowdead, int ndead,
    7240                 :            :                OffsetNumber *nowunused, int nunused,
    7241                 :            :                TransactionId latestRemovedXid)
    7242                 :            : {
    7243                 :            :     xl_heap_clean xlrec;
    7244                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  recptr;
    7245                 :            : 
    7246                 :            :     /* Caller should not call me on a non-WAL-logged relation */
    7247                 :            :     Assert(RelationNeedsWAL(reln));
    7248                 :            : 
    7249                 :      88981 :     xlrec.latestRemovedXid = latestRemovedXid;
    7250                 :      88981 :     xlrec.nredirected = nredirected;
    7251                 :      88981 :     xlrec.ndead = ndead;
    7252                 :            : 
    7253                 :      88981 :     XLogBeginInsert();
    7254                 :      88981 :     XLogRegisterData((char *) &xlrec, SizeOfHeapClean);
    7255                 :            : 
    7256                 :      88981 :     XLogRegisterBuffer(0, buffer, REGBUF_STANDARD);
    7257                 :            : 
    7258                 :            :     /*
    7259                 :            :      * The OffsetNumber arrays are not actually in the buffer, but we pretend
    7260                 :            :      * that they are.  When XLogInsert stores the whole buffer, the offset
    7261                 :            :      * arrays need not be stored too.  Note that even if all three arrays are
    7262                 :            :      * empty, we want to expose the buffer as a candidate for whole-page
    7263                 :            :      * storage, since this record type implies a defragmentation operation
    7264                 :            :      * even if no line pointers changed state.
    7265                 :            :      */
    7266         [ +  + ]:      88981 :     if (nredirected > 0)
    7267                 :      12431 :         XLogRegisterBufData(0, (char *) redirected,
    7268                 :            :                             nredirected * sizeof(OffsetNumber) * 2);
    7269                 :            : 
    7270         [ +  + ]:      88981 :     if (ndead > 0)
    7271                 :      60069 :         XLogRegisterBufData(0, (char *) nowdead,
    7272                 :            :                             ndead * sizeof(OffsetNumber));
    7273                 :            : 
    7274         [ +  + ]:      88981 :     if (nunused > 0)

    7276                 :            :                             nunused * sizeof(OffsetNumber));
    7277                 :            : 
    7278                 :      88981 :     recptr = XLogInsert(RM_HEAP2_ID, XLOG_HEAP2_CLEAN);
    7279                 :            : 
    7280                 :      88981 :     return recptr;
    7281                 :            : }

    7283                 :            : /*
    7284                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert for a heap-freeze operation.  Caller must have already
    7285                 :            :  * modified the buffer and marked it dirty.
    7286                 :            :  */
    7287                 :            : XLogRecPtr
    7288                 :        339 : log_heap_freeze(Relation reln, Buffer buffer, TransactionId cutoff_xid,

    7318                 :            : 
    7319                 :            : /*
    7320                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert for a heap-visible operation.  'block' is the block
    7321                 :            :  * being marked all-visible, and vm_buffer is the buffer containing the
    7322                 :            :  * corresponding visibility map block.  Both should have already been modified
    7323                 :            :  * and dirtied.
    7324                 :            :  *

    7326                 :            :  * heap_buffer, if necessary.
    7327                 :            :  */
    7328                 :            : XLogRecPtr
    7329                 :      14720 : log_heap_visible(RelFileNode rnode, Buffer heap_buffer, Buffer vm_buffer,

    7355                 :            : 
    7356                 :            : /*
    7357                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert for a heap-update operation.  Caller must already
    7358                 :            :  * have modified the buffer(s) and marked them dirty.
    7359                 :            :  */
    7360                 :            : static XLogRecPtr
    7361                 :     476022 : log_heap_update(Relation reln, Buffer oldbuf,
    7362                 :            :                 Buffer newbuf, HeapTuple oldtup, HeapTuple newtup,
    7363                 :            :                 HeapTuple old_key_tuple,
    7364                 :            :                 bool all_visible_cleared, bool new_all_visible_cleared)
    7365                 :            : {
    7366                 :            :     xl_heap_update xlrec;
    7367                 :            :     xl_heap_header xlhdr;
    7368                 :            :     xl_heap_header xlhdr_idx;
    7369                 :            :     uint8       info;
    7370                 :            :     uint16      prefix_suffix[2];
    7371                 :     476022 :     uint16      prefixlen = 0,
    7372                 :     476022 :                 suffixlen = 0;
    7373                 :            :     XLogRecPtr  recptr;
    7374         [ -  + ]:     476022 :     Page        page = BufferGetPage(newbuf);
    7375 [ +  - ][ +  - ]:     476022 :     bool        need_tuple_data = RelationIsLogicallyLogged(reln);
                 [ +  + ]
    7376                 :            :     bool        init;
    7377                 :            :     int         bufflags;
    7378                 :            : 
    7379                 :            :     /* Caller should not call me on a non-WAL-logged relation */
    7380                 :            :     Assert(RelationNeedsWAL(reln));
    7381                 :            : 
    7382                 :     476022 :     XLogBeginInsert();
    7383                 :            : 
    7384         [ +  + ]:     476022 :     if (HeapTupleIsHeapOnly(newtup))
    7385                 :      94294 :         info = XLOG_HEAP_HOT_UPDATE;
    7386                 :            :     else
    7387                 :     381728 :         info = XLOG_HEAP_UPDATE;
    7388                 :            : 
    7389                 :            :     /*
    7390                 :            :      * If the old and new tuple are on the same page, we only need to log the
    7391                 :            :      * parts of the new tuple that were changed.  That saves on the amount of
    7392                 :            :      * WAL we need to write.  Currently, we just count any unchanged bytes in
    7393                 :            :      * the beginning and end of the tuple.  That's quick to check, and
    7394                 :            :      * perfectly covers the common case that only one field is updated.
    7395                 :            :      *
    7396                 :            :      * We could do this even if the old and new tuple are on different pages,
    7397                 :            :      * but only if we don't make a full-page image of the old page, which is
    7398                 :            :      * difficult to know in advance.  Also, if the old tuple is corrupt for
    7399                 :            :      * some reason, it would allow the corruption to propagate the new page,
    7400                 :            :      * so it seems best to avoid.  Under the general assumption that most
    7401                 :            :      * updates tend to create the new tuple version on the same page, there
    7402                 :            :      * isn't much to be gained by doing this across pages anyway.
    7403                 :            :      *
    7404                 :            :      * Skip this if we're taking a full-page image of the new page, as we
    7405                 :            :      * don't include the new tuple in the WAL record in that case.  Also
    7406                 :            :      * disable if wal_level='logical', as logical decoding needs to be able to
    7407                 :            :      * read the new tuple in whole from the WAL record alone.
    7408                 :            :      */
    7409         [ +  + ]:     483204 :     if (oldbuf == newbuf && !need_tuple_data &&
           [ +  +  +  - ]
    7410                 :       7182 :         !XLogCheckBufferNeedsBackup(newbuf))
    7411                 :            :     {
    7412                 :       7182 :         char       *oldp = (char *) oldtup->t_data + oldtup->t_data->t_hoff;
    7413                 :       7182 :         char       *newp = (char *) newtup->t_data + newtup->t_data->t_hoff;
    7414                 :       7182 :         int         oldlen = oldtup->t_len - oldtup->t_data->t_hoff;
    7415                 :       7182 :         int         newlen = newtup->t_len - newtup->t_data->t_hoff;
    7416                 :            : 
    7417                 :            :         /* Check for common prefix between old and new tuple */
    7418         [ +  + ]:     355207 :         for (prefixlen = 0; prefixlen < Min(oldlen, newlen); prefixlen++)
    7419                 :            :         {
    7420         [ +  + ]:     355130 :             if (newp[prefixlen] != oldp[prefixlen])
    7421                 :       7105 :                 break;
    7422                 :            :         }
    7423                 :            : 
    7424                 :            :         /*
    7425                 :            :          * Storing the length of the prefix takes 2 bytes, so we need to save
    7426                 :            :          * at least 3 bytes or there's no point.
    7427                 :            :          */
    7428         [ -  + ]:       7182 :         if (prefixlen < 3)
    7429                 :          0 :             prefixlen = 0;
    7430                 :            : 
    7431                 :            :         /* Same for suffix */
    7432         [ +  + ]:     677044 :         for (suffixlen = 0; suffixlen < Min(oldlen, newlen) - prefixlen; suffixlen++)
    7433                 :            :         {
    7434         [ +  + ]:     676967 :             if (newp[newlen - suffixlen - 1] != oldp[oldlen - suffixlen - 1])
    7435                 :       7105 :                 break;
    7436                 :            :         }
    7437         [ +  + ]:       7182 :         if (suffixlen < 3)
    7438                 :        113 :             suffixlen = 0;
    7439                 :            :     }
    7440                 :            : 
    7441                 :            :     /* Prepare main WAL data chain */
    7442                 :     476022 :     xlrec.flags = 0;
    7443         [ +  + ]:     476022 :     if (all_visible_cleared)

    7446                 :       4762 :         xlrec.flags |= XLH_UPDATE_NEW_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED;

    7448                 :       7182 :         xlrec.flags |= XLH_UPDATE_PREFIX_FROM_OLD;

    7452                 :            :     {

    7455                 :            :         {
    7456         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (reln->rd_rel->relreplident == REPLICA_IDENTITY_FULL)

    7462                 :            : 
    7463                 :            :     /* If new tuple is the single and first tuple on page... */
    7464 [ +  + ][ +  - ]:     476022 :     if (ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&(newtup->t_self)) == FirstOffsetNumber &&

    7466                 :            :     {
    7467                 :      20580 :         info |= XLOG_HEAP_INIT_PAGE;

    7472                 :            : 
    7473                 :            :     /* Prepare WAL data for the old page */

    7477                 :     476022 :                                               oldtup->t_data->t_infomask2);

    7479                 :            :     /* Prepare WAL data for the new page */
    7480                 :     476022 :     xlrec.new_offnum = ItemPointerGetOffsetNumber(&newtup->t_self);

    7482                 :            :

    7488                 :            : 
    7489                 :     476022 :     XLogRegisterBuffer(0, newbuf, bufflags);
    7490         [ +  + ]:     476022 :     if (oldbuf != newbuf)
    7491                 :     202726 :         XLogRegisterBuffer(1, oldbuf, REGBUF_STANDARD);
    7492                 :            : 
    7493                 :     476022 :     XLogRegisterData((char *) &xlrec, SizeOfHeapUpdate);
    7494                 :            : 
    7495                 :            :     /*
    7496                 :            :      * Prepare WAL data for the new tuple.
    7497                 :            :      */
    7498 [ +  + ][ -  + ]:     476022 :     if (prefixlen > 0 || suffixlen > 0)
    7499                 :            :     {

    7507                 :            :         {

    7509                 :            :         }
    7510                 :            :         else
    7511                 :            :         {
    7512                 :          0 :             XLogRegisterBufData(0, (char *) &suffixlen, sizeof(uint16));
    7513                 :            :         }
    7514                 :            :     }
    7515                 :            : 
    7516                 :     476022 :     xlhdr.t_infomask2 = newtup->t_data->t_infomask2;
    7517                 :     476022 :     xlhdr.t_infomask = newtup->t_data->t_infomask;
    7518                 :     476022 :     xlhdr.t_hoff = newtup->t_data->t_hoff;
    7519                 :            :     Assert(SizeofHeapTupleHeader + prefixlen + suffixlen <= newtup->t_len);
    7520                 :            : 
    7521                 :            :     /*
    7522                 :            :      * PG73FORMAT: write bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] + data
    7523                 :            :      *
    7524                 :            :      * The 'data' doesn't include the common prefix or suffix.
    7525                 :            :      */
    7526                 :     476022 :     XLogRegisterBufData(0, (char *) &xlhdr, SizeOfHeapHeader);
    7527         [ +  + ]:     476022 :     if (prefixlen == 0)
    7528                 :            :     {

    7530                 :     468840 :                             ((char *) newtup->t_data) + SizeofHeapTupleHeader,
    7531                 :     468840 :                             newtup->t_len - SizeofHeapTupleHeader - suffixlen);
    7532                 :            :     }
    7533                 :            :     else
    7534                 :            :     {
    7535                 :            :         /*
    7536                 :            :          * Have to write the null bitmap and data after the common prefix as
    7537                 :            :          * two separate rdata entries.
    7538                 :            :          */
    7539                 :            :         /* bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] */
    7540         [ +  - ]:       7182 :         if (newtup->t_data->t_hoff - SizeofHeapTupleHeader > 0)
    7541                 :            :         {
    7542                 :       7182 :             XLogRegisterBufData(0,
    7543                 :       7182 :                                 ((char *) newtup->t_data) + SizeofHeapTupleHeader,
    7544                 :       7182 :                                 newtup->t_data->t_hoff - SizeofHeapTupleHeader);
    7545                 :            :         }
    7546                 :            :

    7549                 :       7182 :                             ((char *) newtup->t_data) + newtup->t_data->t_hoff + prefixlen,

    7552                 :            :

    7567                 :            :

    7575                 :            : 
    7576                 :            : /*
    7577                 :            :  * Perform XLogInsert of an XLOG_HEAP2_NEW_CID record

    7650                 :            : 
    7651                 :            : /*
    7652                 :            :  * Build a heap tuple representing the configured REPLICA IDENTITY to represent
    7653                 :            :  * the old tuple in a UPDATE or DELETE.
    7654                 :            :  *
    7655                 :            :  * Returns NULL if there's no need to log an identity or if there's no suitable
    7656                 :            :  * key defined.
    7657                 :            :  *
    7658                 :            :  * key_changed should be false if caller knows that no replica identity
    7659                 :            :  * columns changed value.  It's always true in the DELETE case.
    7660                 :            :  *
    7661                 :            :  * *copy is set to true if the returned tuple is a modified copy rather than
    7662                 :            :  * the same tuple that was passed in.
    7663                 :            :  */

    7774                 :            : /*
    7775                 :            :  * Handles XLOG_HEAP2_CLEAN record type
    7776                 :            :  */
    7777                 :            : static void
    7778                 :          0 : heap_xlog_clean(XLogReaderState *record)
    7779                 :            : {
    7780                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    7781                 :          0 :     xl_heap_clean *xlrec = (xl_heap_clean *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    7782                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    7783                 :            :     RelFileNode rnode;
    7784                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    7785                 :            :     XLogRedoAction action;
    7786                 :            : 
    7787                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &rnode, NULL, &blkno);
    7788                 :            : 
    7789                 :            :     /*
    7790                 :            :      * We're about to remove tuples. In Hot Standby mode, ensure that there's
    7791                 :            :      * no queries running for which the removed tuples are still visible.
    7792                 :            :      *
    7793                 :            :      * Not all HEAP2_CLEAN records remove tuples with xids, so we only want to
    7794                 :            :      * conflict on the records that cause MVCC failures for user queries. If
    7795                 :            :      * latestRemovedXid is invalid, skip conflict processing.
    7796                 :            :      */
    7797 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (InHotStandby && TransactionIdIsValid(xlrec->latestRemovedXid))
    7798                 :          0 :         ResolveRecoveryConflictWithSnapshot(xlrec->latestRemovedXid, rnode);
    7799                 :            : 
    7800                 :            :     /*
    7801                 :            :      * If we have a full-page image, restore it (using a cleanup lock) and
    7802                 :            :      * we're done.
    7803                 :            :      */
    7804                 :          0 :     action = XLogReadBufferForRedoExtended(record, 0, RBM_NORMAL, true,
    7805                 :            :                                            &buffer);
    7806         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    7807                 :            :     {
    7808         [ #  # ]:          0 :         Page        page = (Page) BufferGetPage(buffer);
    7809                 :            :         OffsetNumber *end;
    7810                 :            :         OffsetNumber *redirected;
    7811                 :            :         OffsetNumber *nowdead;
    7812                 :            :         OffsetNumber *nowunused;

    7815                 :            :         int         nunused;
    7816                 :            :         Size        datalen;
    7817                 :            :

    7819                 :            :
