    7822                 :          0 :         end = (OffsetNumber *) ((char *) redirected + datalen);
    7823                 :          0 :         nowdead = redirected + (nredirected * 2);
    7824                 :          0 :         nowunused = nowdead + ndead;
    7825                 :          0 :         nunused = (end - nowunused);
    7826                 :            :         Assert(nunused >= 0);
    7827                 :            : 
    7828                 :            :         /* Update all line pointers per the record, and repair fragmentation */
    7829                 :          0 :         heap_page_prune_execute(buffer,
    7830                 :            :                                 redirected, nredirected,
    7831                 :            :                                 nowdead, ndead,
    7832                 :            :                                 nowunused, nunused);
    7833                 :            : 
    7834                 :            :         /*
    7835                 :            :          * Note: we don't worry about updating the page's prunability hints.
    7836                 :            :          * At worst this will cause an extra prune cycle to occur soon.
    7837                 :            :          */
    7838                 :            : 
    7839                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    7840                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    7841                 :            :     }
    7842                 :            : 
    7843         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    7844                 :            :     {
    7845         [ #  # ]:          0 :         Size        freespace = PageGetHeapFreeSpace(BufferGetPage(buffer));
    7846                 :            : 
    7847                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    7848                 :            : 
    7849                 :            :         /*
    7850                 :            :          * After cleaning records from a page, it's useful to update the FSM
    7851                 :            :          * about it, as it may cause the page become target for insertions
    7852                 :            :          * later even if vacuum decides not to visit it (which is possible if
    7853                 :            :          * gets marked all-visible.)
    7854                 :            :          *
    7855                 :            :          * Do this regardless of a full-page image being applied, since the
    7856                 :            :          * FSM data is not in the page anyway.
    7857                 :            :          */
    7858                 :          0 :         XLogRecordPageWithFreeSpace(rnode, blkno, freespace);
    7859                 :            :     }
    7860                 :          0 : }
    7861                 :            : 
    7862                 :            : /*
    7863                 :            :  * Replay XLOG_HEAP2_VISIBLE record.
    7864                 :            :  *
    7865                 :            :  * The critical integrity requirement here is that we must never end up with
    7866                 :            :  * a situation where the visibility map bit is set, and the page-level
    7867                 :            :  * PD_ALL_VISIBLE bit is clear.  If that were to occur, then a subsequent
    7868                 :            :  * page modification would fail to clear the visibility map bit.
    7869                 :            :  */
    7870                 :            : static void
    7871                 :          0 : heap_xlog_visible(XLogReaderState *record)
    7872                 :            : {
    7873                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    7874                 :          0 :     xl_heap_visible *xlrec = (xl_heap_visible *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    7875                 :          0 :     Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    7876                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    7877                 :            :     Page        page;
    7878                 :            :     RelFileNode rnode;
    7879                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    7880                 :            :     XLogRedoAction action;
    7881                 :            : 
    7882                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 1, &rnode, NULL, &blkno);
    7883                 :            : 
    7884                 :            :     /*
    7885                 :            :      * If there are any Hot Standby transactions running that have an xmin
    7886                 :            :      * horizon old enough that this page isn't all-visible for them, they
    7887                 :            :      * might incorrectly decide that an index-only scan can skip a heap fetch.
    7888                 :            :      *
    7889                 :            :      * NB: It might be better to throw some kind of "soft" conflict here that
    7890                 :            :      * forces any index-only scan that is in flight to perform heap fetches,
    7891                 :            :      * rather than killing the transaction outright.
    7892                 :            :      */
    7893         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (InHotStandby)
    7894                 :          0 :         ResolveRecoveryConflictWithSnapshot(xlrec->cutoff_xid, rnode);
    7895                 :            : 
    7896                 :            :     /*
    7897                 :            :      * Read the heap page, if it still exists. If the heap file has dropped or
    7898                 :            :      * truncated later in recovery, we don't need to update the page, but we'd
    7899                 :            :      * better still update the visibility map.
    7900                 :            :      */
    7901                 :          0 :     action = XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 1, &buffer);
    7902         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    7903                 :            :     {
    7904                 :            :         /*
    7905                 :            :          * We don't bump the LSN of the heap page when setting the visibility
    7906                 :            :          * map bit (unless checksums or wal_hint_bits is enabled, in which
    7907                 :            :          * case we must), because that would generate an unworkable volume of
    7908                 :            :          * full-page writes.  This exposes us to torn page hazards, but since
    7909                 :            :          * we're not inspecting the existing page contents in any way, we
    7910                 :            :          * don't care.
    7911                 :            :          *
    7912                 :            :          * However, all operations that clear the visibility map bit *do* bump
    7913                 :            :          * the LSN, and those operations will only be replayed if the XLOG LSN
    7914                 :            :          * follows the page LSN.  Thus, if the page LSN has advanced past our
    7915                 :            :          * XLOG record's LSN, we mustn't mark the page all-visible, because
    7916                 :            :          * the subsequent update won't be replayed to clear the flag.
    7917                 :            :          */
    7918         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    7919                 :            : 
    7920                 :          0 :         PageSetAllVisible(page);
    7921                 :            : 
    7922                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    7923                 :            :     }
    7924                 :            :     else if (action == BLK_RESTORED)
    7925                 :            :     {
    7926                 :            :         /*
    7927                 :            :          * If heap block was backed up, we already restored it and there's
    7928                 :            :          * nothing more to do. (This can only happen with checksums or
    7929                 :            :          * wal_log_hints enabled.)
    7930                 :            :          */
    7931                 :            :     }
    7932                 :            : 
    7933         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    7934                 :            :     {
    7935         [ #  # ]:          0 :         Size        space = PageGetFreeSpace(BufferGetPage(buffer));
    7936                 :            : 
    7937                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    7938                 :            : 
    7939                 :            :         /*
    7940                 :            :          * Since FSM is not WAL-logged and only updated heuristically, it
    7941                 :            :          * easily becomes stale in standbys.  If the standby is later promoted
    7942                 :            :          * and runs VACUUM, it will skip updating individual free space
    7943                 :            :          * figures for pages that became all-visible (or all-frozen, depending
    7944                 :            :          * on the vacuum mode,) which is troublesome when FreeSpaceMapVacuum
    7945                 :            :          * propagates too optimistic free space values to upper FSM layers;
    7946                 :            :          * later inserters try to use such pages only to find out that they
    7947                 :            :          * are unusable.  This can cause long stalls when there are many such
    7948                 :            :          * pages.
    7949                 :            :          *
    7950                 :            :          * Forestall those problems by updating FSM's idea about a page that
    7951                 :            :          * is becoming all-visible or all-frozen.
    7952                 :            :          *
    7953                 :            :          * Do this regardless of a full-page image being applied, since the
    7954                 :            :          * FSM data is not in the page anyway.
    7955                 :            :          */
    7956         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS)
    7957                 :          0 :             XLogRecordPageWithFreeSpace(rnode, blkno, space);
    7958                 :            :     }
    7959                 :            : 
    7960                 :            :     /*
    7961                 :            :      * Even if we skipped the heap page update due to the LSN interlock, it's
    7962                 :            :      * still safe to update the visibility map.  Any WAL record that clears
    7963                 :            :      * the visibility map bit does so before checking the page LSN, so any
    7964                 :            :      * bits that need to be cleared will still be cleared.
    7965                 :            :      */
    7966         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogReadBufferForRedoExtended(record, 0, RBM_ZERO_ON_ERROR, false,
    7967                 :            :                                       &vmbuffer) == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    7968                 :            :     {
    7969         [ #  # ]:          0 :         Page        vmpage = BufferGetPage(vmbuffer);
    7970                 :            :         Relation    reln;
    7971                 :            : 
    7972                 :            :         /* initialize the page if it was read as zeros */
    7973         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageIsNew(vmpage))
    7974                 :          0 :             PageInit(vmpage, BLCKSZ, 0);
    7975                 :            : 
    7976                 :            :         /*
    7977                 :            :          * XLogReadBufferForRedoExtended locked the buffer. But
    7978                 :            :          * visibilitymap_set will handle locking itself.
    7979                 :            :          */
    7980                 :          0 :         LockBuffer(vmbuffer, BUFFER_LOCK_UNLOCK);
    7981                 :            : 
    7982                 :          0 :         reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(rnode);
    7983                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, blkno, &vmbuffer);
    7984                 :            : 
    7985                 :            :         /*
    7986                 :            :          * Don't set the bit if replay has already passed this point.
    7987                 :            :          *
    7988                 :            :          * It might be safe to do this unconditionally; if replay has passed
    7989                 :            :          * this point, we'll replay at least as far this time as we did
    7990                 :            :          * before, and if this bit needs to be cleared, the record responsible
    7991                 :            :          * for doing so should be again replayed, and clear it.  For right
    7992                 :            :          * now, out of an abundance of conservatism, we use the same test here
    7993                 :            :          * we did for the heap page.  If this results in a dropped bit, no
    7994                 :            :          * real harm is done; and the next VACUUM will fix it.
    7995                 :            :          */
    7996         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (lsn > PageGetLSN(vmpage))
    7997                 :          0 :             visibilitymap_set(reln, blkno, InvalidBuffer, lsn, vmbuffer,
    7998                 :          0 :                               xlrec->cutoff_xid, xlrec->flags);
    7999                 :            : 
    8000                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8001                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8002                 :            :     }
    8003         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (BufferIsValid(vmbuffer))
    8004                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8005                 :          0 : }
    8006                 :            : 
    8007                 :            : /*
    8008                 :            :  * Replay XLOG_HEAP2_FREEZE_PAGE records
    8009                 :            :  */
    8010                 :            : static void
    8011                 :          0 : heap_xlog_freeze_page(XLogReaderState *record)
    8012                 :            : {
    8013                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8014                 :          0 :     xl_heap_freeze_page *xlrec = (xl_heap_freeze_page *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8015                 :          0 :     TransactionId cutoff_xid = xlrec->cutoff_xid;
    8016                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8017                 :            :     int         ntup;
    8018                 :            : 
    8019                 :            :     /*
    8020                 :            :      * In Hot Standby mode, ensure that there's no queries running which still
    8021                 :            :      * consider the frozen xids as running.
    8022                 :            :      */
    8023         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (InHotStandby)
    8024                 :            :     {
    8025                 :            :         RelFileNode rnode;
    8026                 :          0 :         TransactionId latestRemovedXid = cutoff_xid;
    8027                 :            : 
    8028         [ #  # ]:          0 :         TransactionIdRetreat(latestRemovedXid);
    8029                 :            : 
    8030                 :          0 :         XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &rnode, NULL, NULL);
    8031                 :          0 :         ResolveRecoveryConflictWithSnapshot(latestRemovedXid, rnode);
    8032                 :            :     }
    8033                 :            : 
    8034         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer) == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8035                 :            :     {
    8036         [ #  # ]:          0 :         Page        page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8037                 :            :         xl_heap_freeze_tuple *tuples;
    8038                 :            : 
    8039                 :          0 :         tuples = (xl_heap_freeze_tuple *) XLogRecGetBlockData(record, 0, NULL);
    8040                 :            : 
    8041                 :            :         /* now execute freeze plan for each frozen tuple */
    8042         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (ntup = 0; ntup < xlrec->ntuples; ntup++)
    8043                 :            :         {
    8044                 :            :             xl_heap_freeze_tuple *xlrec_tp;
    8045                 :            :             ItemId      lp;
    8046                 :            :             HeapTupleHeader tuple;
    8047                 :            : 
    8048                 :          0 :             xlrec_tp = &tuples[ntup];
    8049                 :          0 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, xlrec_tp->offset); /* offsets are one-based */
    8050                 :          0 :             tuple = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    8051                 :            : 
    8052                 :          0 :             heap_execute_freeze_tuple(tuple, xlrec_tp);
    8053                 :            :         }
    8054                 :            : 
    8055                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8056                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    8057                 :            :     }
    8058         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    8059                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    8060                 :          0 : }
    8061                 :            : 
    8062                 :            : /*
    8063                 :            :  * Given an "infobits" field from an XLog record, set the correct bits in the
    8064                 :            :  * given infomask and infomask2 for the tuple touched by the record.
    8065                 :            :  *
    8066                 :            :  * (This is the reverse of compute_infobits).
    8067                 :            :  */
    8068                 :            : static void
    8069                 :          0 : fix_infomask_from_infobits(uint8 infobits, uint16 *infomask, uint16 *infomask2)
    8070                 :            : {
    8071                 :          0 :     *infomask &= ~(HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI | HEAP_XMAX_LOCK_ONLY |
    8072                 :            :                    HEAP_XMAX_KEYSHR_LOCK | HEAP_XMAX_EXCL_LOCK);
    8073                 :          0 :     *infomask2 &= ~HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED;
    8074                 :            : 
    8075         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (infobits & XLHL_XMAX_IS_MULTI)
    8076                 :          0 :         *infomask |= HEAP_XMAX_IS_MULTI;
    8077         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (infobits & XLHL_XMAX_LOCK_ONLY)
    8078                 :          0 :         *infomask |= HEAP_XMAX_LOCK_ONLY;
    8079         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (infobits & XLHL_XMAX_EXCL_LOCK)
    8080                 :          0 :         *infomask |= HEAP_XMAX_EXCL_LOCK;
    8081                 :            :     /* note HEAP_XMAX_SHR_LOCK isn't considered here */
    8082         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (infobits & XLHL_XMAX_KEYSHR_LOCK)
    8083                 :          0 :         *infomask |= HEAP_XMAX_KEYSHR_LOCK;
    8084                 :            : 
    8085         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (infobits & XLHL_KEYS_UPDATED)
    8086                 :          0 :         *infomask2 |= HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED;
    8087                 :          0 : }
    8088                 :            : 
    8089                 :            : static void
    8090                 :          0 : heap_xlog_delete(XLogReaderState *record)
    8091                 :            : {
    8092                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8093                 :          0 :     xl_heap_delete *xlrec = (xl_heap_delete *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8094                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8095                 :            :     Page        page;
    8096                 :          0 :     ItemId      lp = NULL;
    8097                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8098                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    8099                 :            :     RelFileNode target_node;
    8100                 :            :     ItemPointerData target_tid;
    8101                 :            : 
    8102                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &target_node, NULL, &blkno);
    8103                 :          0 :     ItemPointerSetBlockNumber(&target_tid, blkno);
    8104                 :          0 :     ItemPointerSetOffsetNumber(&target_tid, xlrec->offnum);
    8105                 :            : 
    8106                 :            :     /*
    8107                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8108                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8109                 :            :      */
    8110         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_DELETE_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8111                 :            :     {
    8112                 :          0 :         Relation    reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(target_node);
    8113                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8114                 :            : 
    8115                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, blkno, &vmbuffer);
    8116                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, blkno, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    8117                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8118                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8119                 :            :     }
    8120                 :            : 
    8121         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer) == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8122                 :            :     {
    8123         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8124                 :            : 
    8125 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) >= xlrec->offnum)
    8126                 :          0 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, xlrec->offnum);
    8127                 :            : 
    8128 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) < xlrec->offnum || !ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
                 [ #  # ]
    8129                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid lp");
    8130                 :            : 
    8131                 :          0 :         htup = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    8132                 :            : 
    8133                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask &= ~(HEAP_XMAX_BITS | HEAP_MOVED);
    8134                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask2 &= ~HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED;
    8135                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderClearHotUpdated(htup);
    8136                 :          0 :         fix_infomask_from_infobits(xlrec->infobits_set,
    8137                 :            :                                    &htup->t_infomask, &htup->t_infomask2);
    8138         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (!(xlrec->flags & XLH_DELETE_IS_SUPER))
    8139                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetXmax(htup, xlrec->xmax);
    8140                 :            :         else
    8141                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetXmin(htup, InvalidTransactionId);
    8142                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetCmax(htup, FirstCommandId, false);
    8143                 :            : 
    8144                 :            :         /* Mark the page as a candidate for pruning */
    8145 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         PageSetPrunable(page, XLogRecGetXid(record));
    8146                 :            : 
    8147         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_DELETE_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8148                 :          0 :             PageClearAllVisible(page);
    8149                 :            : 
    8150                 :            :         /* Make sure t_ctid is set correctly */
    8151         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_DELETE_IS_PARTITION_MOVE)
    8152                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetMovedPartitions(htup);
    8153                 :            :         else
    8154                 :          0 :             htup->t_ctid = target_tid;
    8155                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8156                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    8157                 :            :     }
    8158         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    8159                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    8160                 :          0 : }
    8161                 :            : 
    8162                 :            : static void
    8163                 :          0 : heap_xlog_insert(XLogReaderState *record)
    8164                 :            : {
    8165                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8166                 :          0 :     xl_heap_insert *xlrec = (xl_heap_insert *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8167                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8168                 :            :     Page        page;
    8169                 :            :     union
    8170                 :            :     {
    8171                 :            :         HeapTupleHeaderData hdr;
    8172                 :            :         char        data[MaxHeapTupleSize];
    8173                 :            :     }           tbuf;
    8174                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8175                 :            :     xl_heap_header xlhdr;
    8176                 :            :     uint32      newlen;
    8177                 :          0 :     Size        freespace = 0;
    8178                 :            :     RelFileNode target_node;
    8179                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    8180                 :            :     ItemPointerData target_tid;
    8181                 :            :     XLogRedoAction action;
    8182                 :            : 
    8183                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &target_node, NULL, &blkno);
    8184                 :          0 :     ItemPointerSetBlockNumber(&target_tid, blkno);
    8185                 :          0 :     ItemPointerSetOffsetNumber(&target_tid, xlrec->offnum);
    8186                 :            : 
    8187                 :            :     /*
    8188                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8189                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8190                 :            :      */
    8191         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_INSERT_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8192                 :            :     {
    8193                 :          0 :         Relation    reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(target_node);
    8194                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8195                 :            : 
    8196                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, blkno, &vmbuffer);
    8197                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, blkno, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    8198                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8199                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8200                 :            :     }
    8201                 :            : 
    8202                 :            :     /*
    8203                 :            :      * If we inserted the first and only tuple on the page, re-initialize the
    8204                 :            :      * page from scratch.
    8205                 :            :      */
    8206         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogRecGetInfo(record) & XLOG_HEAP_INIT_PAGE)
    8207                 :            :     {
    8208                 :          0 :         buffer = XLogInitBufferForRedo(record, 0);
    8209         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8210                 :          0 :         PageInit(page, BufferGetPageSize(buffer), 0);
    8211                 :          0 :         action = BLK_NEEDS_REDO;
    8212                 :            :     }
    8213                 :            :     else
    8214                 :          0 :         action = XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer);
    8215         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8216                 :            :     {
    8217                 :            :         Size        datalen;
    8218                 :            :         char       *data;
    8219                 :            : 
    8220         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8221                 :            : 
    8222 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) + 1 < xlrec->offnum)
    8223                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid max offset number");
    8224                 :            : 
    8225                 :          0 :         data = XLogRecGetBlockData(record, 0, &datalen);
    8226                 :            : 
    8227                 :          0 :         newlen = datalen - SizeOfHeapHeader;
    8228                 :            :         Assert(datalen > SizeOfHeapHeader && newlen <= MaxHeapTupleSize);
    8229                 :          0 :         memcpy((char *) &xlhdr, data, SizeOfHeapHeader);
    8230                 :          0 :         data += SizeOfHeapHeader;
    8231                 :            : 
    8232                 :          0 :         htup = &tbuf.hdr;
    8233 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         MemSet((char *) htup, 0, SizeofHeapTupleHeader);
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ #  # ]
    8234                 :            :         /* PG73FORMAT: get bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] + data */
    8235                 :          0 :         memcpy((char *) htup + SizeofHeapTupleHeader,
    8236                 :            :                data,
    8237                 :            :                newlen);
    8238                 :          0 :         newlen += SizeofHeapTupleHeader;
    8239                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask2 = xlhdr.t_infomask2;
    8240                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask = xlhdr.t_infomask;
    8241                 :          0 :         htup->t_hoff = xlhdr.t_hoff;
    8242                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetXmin(htup, XLogRecGetXid(record));
    8243                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetCmin(htup, FirstCommandId);
    8244                 :          0 :         htup->t_ctid = target_tid;
    8245                 :            : 
    8246         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageAddItem(page, (Item) htup, newlen, xlrec->offnum,
    8247                 :            :                         true, true) == InvalidOffsetNumber)
    8248                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "failed to add tuple");
    8249                 :            : 
    8250                 :          0 :         freespace = PageGetHeapFreeSpace(page); /* needed to update FSM below */
    8251                 :            : 
    8252                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8253                 :            : 
    8254         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_INSERT_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8255                 :          0 :             PageClearAllVisible(page);
    8256                 :            : 
    8257                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    8258                 :            :     }
    8259         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    8260                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    8261                 :            : 
    8262                 :            :     /*
    8263                 :            :      * If the page is running low on free space, update the FSM as well.
    8264                 :            :      * Arbitrarily, our definition of "low" is less than 20%. We can't do much
    8265                 :            :      * better than that without knowing the fill-factor for the table.
    8266                 :            :      *
    8267                 :            :      * XXX: Don't do this if the page was restored from full page image. We
    8268                 :            :      * don't bother to update the FSM in that case, it doesn't need to be
    8269                 :            :      * totally accurate anyway.
    8270                 :            :      */
    8271 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO && freespace < BLCKSZ / 5)
    8272                 :          0 :         XLogRecordPageWithFreeSpace(target_node, blkno, freespace);
    8273                 :          0 : }
    8274                 :            : 
    8275                 :            : /*
    8276                 :            :  * Handles MULTI_INSERT record type.
    8277                 :            :  */
    8278                 :            : static void
    8279                 :          0 : heap_xlog_multi_insert(XLogReaderState *record)
    8280                 :            : {
    8281                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8282                 :            :     xl_heap_multi_insert *xlrec;
    8283                 :            :     RelFileNode rnode;
    8284                 :            :     BlockNumber blkno;
    8285                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8286                 :            :     Page        page;
    8287                 :            :     union
    8288                 :            :     {
    8289                 :            :         HeapTupleHeaderData hdr;
    8290                 :            :         char        data[MaxHeapTupleSize];
    8291                 :            :     }           tbuf;
    8292                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8293                 :            :     uint32      newlen;
    8294                 :          0 :     Size        freespace = 0;
    8295                 :            :     int         i;
    8296                 :          0 :     bool        isinit = (XLogRecGetInfo(record) & XLOG_HEAP_INIT_PAGE) != 0;
    8297                 :            :     XLogRedoAction action;
    8298                 :            : 
    8299                 :            :     /*
    8300                 :            :      * Insertion doesn't overwrite MVCC data, so no conflict processing is
    8301                 :            :      * required.
    8302                 :            :      */
    8303                 :          0 :     xlrec = (xl_heap_multi_insert *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8304                 :            : 
    8305                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &rnode, NULL, &blkno);
    8306                 :            : 
    8307                 :            :     /*
    8308                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8309                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8310                 :            :      */
    8311         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_INSERT_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8312                 :            :     {
    8313                 :          0 :         Relation    reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(rnode);
    8314                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8315                 :            : 
    8316                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, blkno, &vmbuffer);
    8317                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, blkno, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    8318                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8319                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8320                 :            :     }
    8321                 :            : 
    8322         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (isinit)
    8323                 :            :     {
    8324                 :          0 :         buffer = XLogInitBufferForRedo(record, 0);
    8325         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8326                 :          0 :         PageInit(page, BufferGetPageSize(buffer), 0);
    8327                 :          0 :         action = BLK_NEEDS_REDO;
    8328                 :            :     }
    8329                 :            :     else
    8330                 :          0 :         action = XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer);
    8331         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8332                 :            :     {
    8333                 :            :         char       *tupdata;
    8334                 :            :         char       *endptr;
    8335                 :            :         Size        len;
    8336                 :            : 
    8337                 :            :         /* Tuples are stored as block data */
    8338                 :          0 :         tupdata = XLogRecGetBlockData(record, 0, &len);
    8339                 :          0 :         endptr = tupdata + len;
    8340                 :            : 
    8341         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = (Page) BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8342                 :            : 
    8343         [ #  # ]:          0 :         for (i = 0; i < xlrec->ntuples; i++)
    8344                 :            :         {
    8345                 :            :             OffsetNumber offnum;
    8346                 :            :             xl_multi_insert_tuple *xlhdr;
    8347                 :            : 
    8348                 :            :             /*
    8349                 :            :              * If we're reinitializing the page, the tuples are stored in
    8350                 :            :              * order from FirstOffsetNumber. Otherwise there's an array of
    8351                 :            :              * offsets in the WAL record, and the tuples come after that.
    8352                 :            :              */
    8353         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (isinit)
    8354                 :          0 :                 offnum = FirstOffsetNumber + i;
    8355                 :            :             else
    8356                 :          0 :                 offnum = xlrec->offsets[i];
    8357 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) + 1 < offnum)
    8358                 :          0 :                 elog(PANIC, "invalid max offset number");
    8359                 :            : 
    8360                 :          0 :             xlhdr = (xl_multi_insert_tuple *) SHORTALIGN(tupdata);
    8361                 :          0 :             tupdata = ((char *) xlhdr) + SizeOfMultiInsertTuple;
    8362                 :            : 
    8363                 :          0 :             newlen = xlhdr->datalen;
    8364                 :            :             Assert(newlen <= MaxHeapTupleSize);
    8365                 :          0 :             htup = &tbuf.hdr;
    8366 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :             MemSet((char *) htup, 0, SizeofHeapTupleHeader);
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ #  # ]
    8367                 :            :             /* PG73FORMAT: get bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] + data */
    8368                 :          0 :             memcpy((char *) htup + SizeofHeapTupleHeader,
    8369                 :            :                    (char *) tupdata,
    8370                 :            :                    newlen);
    8371                 :          0 :             tupdata += newlen;
    8372                 :            : 
    8373                 :          0 :             newlen += SizeofHeapTupleHeader;
    8374                 :          0 :             htup->t_infomask2 = xlhdr->t_infomask2;
    8375                 :          0 :             htup->t_infomask = xlhdr->t_infomask;
    8376                 :          0 :             htup->t_hoff = xlhdr->t_hoff;
    8377                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetXmin(htup, XLogRecGetXid(record));
    8378                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetCmin(htup, FirstCommandId);
    8379                 :          0 :             ItemPointerSetBlockNumber(&htup->t_ctid, blkno);
    8380                 :          0 :             ItemPointerSetOffsetNumber(&htup->t_ctid, offnum);
    8381                 :            : 
    8382                 :          0 :             offnum = PageAddItem(page, (Item) htup, newlen, offnum, true, true);
    8383         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (offnum == InvalidOffsetNumber)
    8384                 :          0 :                 elog(PANIC, "failed to add tuple");
    8385                 :            :         }
    8386         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (tupdata != endptr)
    8387                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "total tuple length mismatch");
    8388                 :            : 
    8389                 :          0 :         freespace = PageGetHeapFreeSpace(page); /* needed to update FSM below */
    8390                 :            : 
    8391                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8392                 :            : 
    8393         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_INSERT_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8394                 :          0 :             PageClearAllVisible(page);
    8395                 :            : 
    8396                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    8397                 :            :     }
    8398         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    8399                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    8400                 :            : 
    8401                 :            :     /*
    8402                 :            :      * If the page is running low on free space, update the FSM as well.
    8403                 :            :      * Arbitrarily, our definition of "low" is less than 20%. We can't do much
    8404                 :            :      * better than that without knowing the fill-factor for the table.
    8405                 :            :      *
    8406                 :            :      * XXX: Don't do this if the page was restored from full page image. We
    8407                 :            :      * don't bother to update the FSM in that case, it doesn't need to be
    8408                 :            :      * totally accurate anyway.
    8409                 :            :      */
    8410 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (action == BLK_NEEDS_REDO && freespace < BLCKSZ / 5)
    8411                 :          0 :         XLogRecordPageWithFreeSpace(rnode, blkno, freespace);
    8412                 :          0 : }
    8413                 :            : 
    8414                 :            : /*
    8415                 :            :  * Handles UPDATE and HOT_UPDATE
    8416                 :            :  */
    8417                 :            : static void
    8418                 :          0 : heap_xlog_update(XLogReaderState *record, bool hot_update)
    8419                 :            : {
    8420                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8421                 :          0 :     xl_heap_update *xlrec = (xl_heap_update *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8422                 :            :     RelFileNode rnode;
    8423                 :            :     BlockNumber oldblk;
    8424                 :            :     BlockNumber newblk;
    8425                 :            :     ItemPointerData newtid;
    8426                 :            :     Buffer      obuffer,
    8427                 :            :                 nbuffer;
    8428                 :            :     Page        page;
    8429                 :            :     OffsetNumber offnum;
    8430                 :          0 :     ItemId      lp = NULL;
    8431                 :            :     HeapTupleData oldtup;
    8432                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8433                 :          0 :     uint16      prefixlen = 0,
    8434                 :          0 :                 suffixlen = 0;
    8435                 :            :     char       *newp;
    8436                 :            :     union
    8437                 :            :     {
    8438                 :            :         HeapTupleHeaderData hdr;
    8439                 :            :         char        data[MaxHeapTupleSize];
    8440                 :            :     }           tbuf;
    8441                 :            :     xl_heap_header xlhdr;
    8442                 :            :     uint32      newlen;
    8443                 :          0 :     Size        freespace = 0;
    8444                 :            :     XLogRedoAction oldaction;
    8445                 :            :     XLogRedoAction newaction;
    8446                 :            : 
    8447                 :            :     /* initialize to keep the compiler quiet */
    8448                 :          0 :     oldtup.t_data = NULL;
    8449                 :          0 :     oldtup.t_len = 0;
    8450                 :            : 
    8451                 :          0 :     XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &rnode, NULL, &newblk);
    8452         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 1, NULL, NULL, &oldblk))
    8453                 :            :     {
    8454                 :            :         /* HOT updates are never done across pages */
    8455                 :            :         Assert(!hot_update);
    8456                 :            :     }
    8457                 :            :     else
    8458                 :          0 :         oldblk = newblk;
    8459                 :            : 
    8460                 :          0 :     ItemPointerSet(&newtid, newblk, xlrec->new_offnum);
    8461                 :            : 
    8462                 :            :     /*
    8463                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8464                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8465                 :            :      */
    8466         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_OLD_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8467                 :            :     {
    8468                 :          0 :         Relation    reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(rnode);
    8469                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8470                 :            : 
    8471                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, oldblk, &vmbuffer);
    8472                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, oldblk, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    8473                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8474                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8475                 :            :     }
    8476                 :            : 
    8477                 :            :     /*
    8478                 :            :      * In normal operation, it is important to lock the two pages in
    8479                 :            :      * page-number order, to avoid possible deadlocks against other update
    8480                 :            :      * operations going the other way.  However, during WAL replay there can
    8481                 :            :      * be no other update happening, so we don't need to worry about that. But
    8482                 :            :      * we *do* need to worry that we don't expose an inconsistent state to Hot
    8483                 :            :      * Standby queries --- so the original page can't be unlocked before we've
    8484                 :            :      * added the new tuple to the new page.
    8485                 :            :      */
    8486                 :            : 
    8487                 :            :     /* Deal with old tuple version */
    8488                 :          0 :     oldaction = XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, (oldblk == newblk) ? 0 : 1,
    8489                 :            :                                       &obuffer);
    8490         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (oldaction == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8491                 :            :     {
    8492         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(obuffer);
    8493                 :          0 :         offnum = xlrec->old_offnum;
    8494 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) >= offnum)
    8495                 :          0 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    8496                 :            : 
    8497 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) < offnum || !ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
                 [ #  # ]
    8498                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid lp");
    8499                 :            : 
    8500                 :          0 :         htup = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    8501                 :            : 
    8502                 :          0 :         oldtup.t_data = htup;
    8503                 :          0 :         oldtup.t_len = ItemIdGetLength(lp);
    8504                 :            : 
    8505                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask &= ~(HEAP_XMAX_BITS | HEAP_MOVED);
    8506                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask2 &= ~HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED;
    8507         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (hot_update)
    8508                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderSetHotUpdated(htup);
    8509                 :            :         else
    8510                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeaderClearHotUpdated(htup);
    8511                 :          0 :         fix_infomask_from_infobits(xlrec->old_infobits_set, &htup->t_infomask,
    8512                 :            :                                    &htup->t_infomask2);
    8513                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetXmax(htup, xlrec->old_xmax);
    8514                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetCmax(htup, FirstCommandId, false);
    8515                 :            :         /* Set forward chain link in t_ctid */
    8516                 :          0 :         htup->t_ctid = newtid;
    8517                 :            : 
    8518                 :            :         /* Mark the page as a candidate for pruning */
    8519 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         PageSetPrunable(page, XLogRecGetXid(record));
    8520                 :            : 
    8521         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_OLD_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8522                 :          0 :             PageClearAllVisible(page);
    8523                 :            : 
    8524                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8525                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(obuffer);
    8526                 :            :     }
    8527                 :            : 
    8528                 :            :     /*
    8529                 :            :      * Read the page the new tuple goes into, if different from old.
    8530                 :            :      */
    8531         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (oldblk == newblk)
    8532                 :            :     {
    8533                 :          0 :         nbuffer = obuffer;
    8534                 :          0 :         newaction = oldaction;
    8535                 :            :     }
    8536         [ #  # ]:          0 :     else if (XLogRecGetInfo(record) & XLOG_HEAP_INIT_PAGE)
    8537                 :            :     {
    8538                 :          0 :         nbuffer = XLogInitBufferForRedo(record, 0);
    8539         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = (Page) BufferGetPage(nbuffer);
    8540                 :          0 :         PageInit(page, BufferGetPageSize(nbuffer), 0);
    8541                 :          0 :         newaction = BLK_NEEDS_REDO;
    8542                 :            :     }
    8543                 :            :     else
    8544                 :          0 :         newaction = XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &nbuffer);
    8545                 :            : 
    8546                 :            :     /*
    8547                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8548                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8549                 :            :      */
    8550         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_NEW_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8551                 :            :     {
    8552                 :          0 :         Relation    reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(rnode);
    8553                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8554                 :            : 
    8555                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, newblk, &vmbuffer);
    8556                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, newblk, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_VALID_BITS);
    8557                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8558                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8559                 :            :     }
    8560                 :            : 
    8561                 :            :     /* Deal with new tuple */
    8562         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (newaction == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8563                 :            :     {
    8564                 :            :         char       *recdata;
    8565                 :            :         char       *recdata_end;
    8566                 :            :         Size        datalen;
    8567                 :            :         Size        tuplen;
    8568                 :            : 
    8569                 :          0 :         recdata = XLogRecGetBlockData(record, 0, &datalen);
    8570                 :          0 :         recdata_end = recdata + datalen;
    8571                 :            : 
    8572         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(nbuffer);
    8573                 :            : 
    8574                 :          0 :         offnum = xlrec->new_offnum;
    8575 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) + 1 < offnum)
    8576                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid max offset number");
    8577                 :            : 
    8578         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_PREFIX_FROM_OLD)
    8579                 :            :         {
    8580                 :            :             Assert(newblk == oldblk);
    8581                 :          0 :             memcpy(&prefixlen, recdata, sizeof(uint16));
    8582                 :          0 :             recdata += sizeof(uint16);
    8583                 :            :         }
    8584         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_SUFFIX_FROM_OLD)
    8585                 :            :         {
    8586                 :            :             Assert(newblk == oldblk);
    8587                 :          0 :             memcpy(&suffixlen, recdata, sizeof(uint16));
    8588                 :          0 :             recdata += sizeof(uint16);
    8589                 :            :         }
    8590                 :            : 
    8591                 :          0 :         memcpy((char *) &xlhdr, recdata, SizeOfHeapHeader);
    8592                 :          0 :         recdata += SizeOfHeapHeader;
    8593                 :            : 
    8594                 :          0 :         tuplen = recdata_end - recdata;
    8595                 :            :         Assert(tuplen <= MaxHeapTupleSize);
    8596                 :            : 
    8597                 :          0 :         htup = &tbuf.hdr;
    8598 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         MemSet((char *) htup, 0, SizeofHeapTupleHeader);
         [ #  # ][ #  # ]
                 [ #  # ]
    8599                 :            : 
    8600                 :            :         /*
    8601                 :            :          * Reconstruct the new tuple using the prefix and/or suffix from the
    8602                 :            :          * old tuple, and the data stored in the WAL record.
    8603                 :            :          */
    8604                 :          0 :         newp = (char *) htup + SizeofHeapTupleHeader;
    8605         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (prefixlen > 0)
    8606                 :            :         {
    8607                 :            :             int         len;
    8608                 :            : 
    8609                 :            :             /* copy bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] from WAL record */
    8610                 :          0 :             len = xlhdr.t_hoff - SizeofHeapTupleHeader;
    8611                 :          0 :             memcpy(newp, recdata, len);
    8612                 :          0 :             recdata += len;
    8613                 :          0 :             newp += len;
    8614                 :            : 
    8615                 :            :             /* copy prefix from old tuple */
    8616                 :          0 :             memcpy(newp, (char *) oldtup.t_data + oldtup.t_data->t_hoff, prefixlen);
    8617                 :          0 :             newp += prefixlen;
    8618                 :            : 
    8619                 :            :             /* copy new tuple data from WAL record */
    8620                 :          0 :             len = tuplen - (xlhdr.t_hoff - SizeofHeapTupleHeader);
    8621                 :          0 :             memcpy(newp, recdata, len);
    8622                 :          0 :             recdata += len;
    8623                 :          0 :             newp += len;
    8624                 :            :         }
    8625                 :            :         else
    8626                 :            :         {
    8627                 :            :             /*
    8628                 :            :              * copy bitmap [+ padding] [+ oid] + data from record, all in one
    8629                 :            :              * go
    8630                 :            :              */
    8631                 :          0 :             memcpy(newp, recdata, tuplen);
    8632                 :          0 :             recdata += tuplen;
    8633                 :          0 :             newp += tuplen;
    8634                 :            :         }
    8635                 :            :         Assert(recdata == recdata_end);
    8636                 :            : 
    8637                 :            :         /* copy suffix from old tuple */
    8638         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (suffixlen > 0)
    8639                 :          0 :             memcpy(newp, (char *) oldtup.t_data + oldtup.t_len - suffixlen, suffixlen);
    8640                 :            : 
    8641                 :          0 :         newlen = SizeofHeapTupleHeader + tuplen + prefixlen + suffixlen;
    8642                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask2 = xlhdr.t_infomask2;
    8643                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask = xlhdr.t_infomask;
    8644                 :          0 :         htup->t_hoff = xlhdr.t_hoff;
    8645                 :            : 
    8646                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetXmin(htup, XLogRecGetXid(record));
    8647                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetCmin(htup, FirstCommandId);
    8648                 :          0 :         HeapTupleHeaderSetXmax(htup, xlrec->new_xmax);
    8649                 :            :         /* Make sure there is no forward chain link in t_ctid */
    8650                 :          0 :         htup->t_ctid = newtid;
    8651                 :            : 
    8652                 :          0 :         offnum = PageAddItem(page, (Item) htup, newlen, offnum, true, true);
    8653         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (offnum == InvalidOffsetNumber)
    8654                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "failed to add tuple");
    8655                 :            : 
    8656         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (xlrec->flags & XLH_UPDATE_NEW_ALL_VISIBLE_CLEARED)
    8657                 :          0 :             PageClearAllVisible(page);
    8658                 :            : 
    8659                 :          0 :         freespace = PageGetHeapFreeSpace(page); /* needed to update FSM below */
    8660                 :            : 
    8661                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8662                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(nbuffer);
    8663                 :            :     }
    8664                 :            : 
    8665 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(nbuffer) && nbuffer != obuffer)
    8666                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(nbuffer);
    8667         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(obuffer))
    8668                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(obuffer);
    8669                 :            : 
    8670                 :            :     /*
    8671                 :            :      * If the new page is running low on free space, update the FSM as well.
    8672                 :            :      * Arbitrarily, our definition of "low" is less than 20%. We can't do much
    8673                 :            :      * better than that without knowing the fill-factor for the table.
    8674                 :            :      *
    8675                 :            :      * However, don't update the FSM on HOT updates, because after crash
    8676                 :            :      * recovery, either the old or the new tuple will certainly be dead and
    8677                 :            :      * prunable. After pruning, the page will have roughly as much free space
    8678                 :            :      * as it did before the update, assuming the new tuple is about the same
    8679                 :            :      * size as the old one.
    8680                 :            :      *
    8681                 :            :      * XXX: Don't do this if the page was restored from full page image. We
    8682                 :            :      * don't bother to update the FSM in that case, it doesn't need to be
    8683                 :            :      * totally accurate anyway.
    8684                 :            :      */
    8685 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     if (newaction == BLK_NEEDS_REDO && !hot_update && freespace < BLCKSZ / 5)
                 [ #  # ]
    8686                 :          0 :         XLogRecordPageWithFreeSpace(rnode, newblk, freespace);
    8687                 :          0 : }
    8688                 :            : 
    8689                 :            : static void
    8690                 :          0 : heap_xlog_confirm(XLogReaderState *record)
    8691                 :            : {
    8692                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8693                 :          0 :     xl_heap_confirm *xlrec = (xl_heap_confirm *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8694                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8695                 :            :     Page        page;
    8696                 :            :     OffsetNumber offnum;
    8697                 :          0 :     ItemId      lp = NULL;
    8698                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8699                 :            : 
    8700         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer) == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8701                 :            :     {
    8702         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8703                 :            : 
    8704                 :          0 :         offnum = xlrec->offnum;
    8705 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) >= offnum)
    8706                 :          0 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    8707                 :            : 
    8708 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) < offnum || !ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
                 [ #  # ]
    8709                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid lp");
    8710                 :            : 
    8711                 :          0 :         htup = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    8712                 :            : 
    8713                 :            :         /*
    8714                 :            :          * Confirm tuple as actually inserted
    8715                 :            :          */
    8716                 :          0 :         ItemPointerSet(&htup->t_ctid, BufferGetBlockNumber(buffer), offnum);
    8717                 :            : 
    8718                 :          0 :         PageSetLSN(page, lsn);
    8719                 :          0 :         MarkBufferDirty(buffer);
    8720                 :            :     }
    8721         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (BufferIsValid(buffer))
    8722                 :          0 :         UnlockReleaseBuffer(buffer);
    8723                 :          0 : }
    8724                 :            : 
    8725                 :            : static void
    8726                 :          0 : heap_xlog_lock(XLogReaderState *record)
    8727                 :            : {
    8728                 :          0 :     XLogRecPtr  lsn = record->EndRecPtr;
    8729                 :          0 :     xl_heap_lock *xlrec = (xl_heap_lock *) XLogRecGetData(record);
    8730                 :            :     Buffer      buffer;
    8731                 :            :     Page        page;
    8732                 :            :     OffsetNumber offnum;
    8733                 :          0 :     ItemId      lp = NULL;
    8734                 :            :     HeapTupleHeader htup;
    8735                 :            : 
    8736                 :            :     /*
    8737                 :            :      * The visibility map may need to be fixed even if the heap page is
    8738                 :            :      * already up-to-date.
    8739                 :            :      */
    8740         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (xlrec->flags & XLH_LOCK_ALL_FROZEN_CLEARED)
    8741                 :            :     {
    8742                 :            :         RelFileNode rnode;
    8743                 :          0 :         Buffer      vmbuffer = InvalidBuffer;
    8744                 :            :         BlockNumber block;
    8745                 :            :         Relation    reln;
    8746                 :            : 
    8747                 :          0 :         XLogRecGetBlockTag(record, 0, &rnode, NULL, &block);
    8748                 :          0 :         reln = CreateFakeRelcacheEntry(rnode);
    8749                 :            : 
    8750                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_pin(reln, block, &vmbuffer);
    8751                 :          0 :         visibilitymap_clear(reln, block, vmbuffer, VISIBILITYMAP_ALL_FROZEN);
    8752                 :            : 
    8753                 :          0 :         ReleaseBuffer(vmbuffer);
    8754                 :          0 :         FreeFakeRelcacheEntry(reln);
    8755                 :            :     }
    8756                 :            : 
    8757         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (XLogReadBufferForRedo(record, 0, &buffer) == BLK_NEEDS_REDO)
    8758                 :            :     {
    8759         [ #  # ]:          0 :         page = (Page) BufferGetPage(buffer);
    8760                 :            : 
    8761                 :          0 :         offnum = xlrec->offnum;
    8762 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) >= offnum)
    8763                 :          0 :             lp = PageGetItemId(page, offnum);
    8764                 :            : 
    8765 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page) < offnum || !ItemIdIsNormal(lp))
                 [ #  # ]
    8766                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "invalid lp");
    8767                 :            : 
    8768                 :          0 :         htup = (HeapTupleHeader) PageGetItem(page, lp);
    8769                 :            : 
    8770                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask &= ~(HEAP_XMAX_BITS | HEAP_MOVED);
    8771                 :          0 :         htup->t_infomask2 &= ~HEAP_KEYS_UPDATED;
    8772                 :          0 :         fix_infomask_from_infobits(xlrec->infobits_set, &htup->t_infomask,
    8773                 :            :                                    &htup->t_infomask2);
    8774                 :            : 
    8775                 :            :         /*
    8776                 :            :          * Clear relevant update flags, but only if the modified infomask says
    8777                 :            :          * there's no update.
    8778                 :            :          */
    8779 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :         if (HEAP_XMAX_IS_LOCKED_ONLY(htup->t_infomask))

    8786                 :            :         }

    8897                 :            : void
    8898                 :          0 : heap_redo(XLogReaderState *record)
    8899                 :            : {
    8900                 :          0 :     uint8       info = XLogRecGetInfo(record) & ~XLR_INFO_MASK;
    8901                 :            : 
    8902                 :            :     /*
    8903                 :            :      * These operations don't overwrite MVCC data so no conflict processing is
    8904                 :            :      * required. The ones in heap2 rmgr do.
    8905                 :            :      */
    8906                 :            :

             #  #  #  #

    8909                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_INSERT:
    8910                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_insert(record);
    8911                 :          0 :             break;
    8912                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_DELETE:
    8913                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_delete(record);
    8914                 :          0 :             break;
    8915                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_UPDATE:
    8916                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_update(record, false);
    8917                 :          0 :             break;
    8918                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_TRUNCATE:
    8919                 :            :

    8921                 :            :              * TRUNCATE is a no-op because the actions are already logged as
    8922                 :            :              * SMGR WAL records.  TRUNCATE WAL record only exists for logical
    8923                 :            :              * decoding.
    8924                 :            :              */
    8925                 :          0 :             break;
    8926                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_HOT_UPDATE:
    8927                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_update(record, true);
    8928                 :          0 :             break;
    8929                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP_CONFIRM:
    8930                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_confirm(record);
    8931                 :          0 :             break;

    8933                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_lock(record);

    8943                 :            : void
    8944                 :          0 : heap2_redo(XLogReaderState *record)
    8945                 :            : {
    8946                 :          0 :     uint8       info = XLogRecGetInfo(record) & ~XLR_INFO_MASK;
    8947                 :            : 
    8948   [ #  #  #  #  :          0 :     switch (info & XLOG_HEAP_OPMASK)

    8952                 :          0 :             break;

    8954                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_freeze_page(record);
    8955                 :          0 :             break;

    8960                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_visible(record);
    8961                 :          0 :             break;

    8963                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_multi_insert(record);
    8964                 :          0 :             break;
    8965                 :            :         case XLOG_HEAP2_LOCK_UPDATED:
    8966                 :          0 :             heap_xlog_lock_updated(record);
    8967                 :          0 :             break;

    8969                 :            :

    8971                 :            :              * Nothing to do on a real replay, only used during logical
    8972                 :            :              * decoding.
    8973                 :            :              */

    8977                 :          0 :             break;
