    8979                 :          0 :             elog(PANIC, "heap2_redo: unknown op code %u", info);
    8980                 :            :     }
    8981                 :          0 : }
    8982                 :            : 
    8983                 :            : /*
    8984                 :            :  *  heap_sync       - sync a heap, for use when no WAL has been written
    8985                 :            :  *
    8986                 :            :  * This forces the heap contents (including TOAST heap if any) down to disk.
    8987                 :            :  * If we skipped using WAL, and WAL is otherwise needed, we must force the
    8988                 :            :  * relation down to disk before it's safe to commit the transaction.  This
    8989                 :            :  * requires writing out any dirty buffers and then doing a forced fsync.
    8990                 :            :  *
    8991                 :            :  * Indexes are not touched.  (Currently, index operations associated with
    8992                 :            :  * the commands that use this are WAL-logged and so do not need fsync.
    8993                 :            :  * That behavior might change someday, but in any case it's likely that
    8994                 :            :  * any fsync decisions required would be per-index and hence not appropriate
    8995                 :            :  * to be done here.)
    8996                 :            :  */
    8997                 :            : void
    8998                 :          0 : heap_sync(Relation rel)
    8999                 :            : {
    9000                 :            :     /* non-WAL-logged tables never need fsync */
    9001         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (!RelationNeedsWAL(rel))
    9002                 :          0 :         return;
    9003                 :            : 
    9004                 :            :     /* main heap */
    9005                 :          0 :     FlushRelationBuffers(rel);
    9006                 :            :     /* FlushRelationBuffers will have opened rd_smgr */
    9007                 :          0 :     smgrimmedsync(rel->rd_smgr, MAIN_FORKNUM);
    9008                 :            : 
    9009                 :            :     /* FSM is not critical, don't bother syncing it */
    9010                 :            : 
    9011                 :            :     /* toast heap, if any */
    9012         [ #  # ]:          0 :     if (OidIsValid(rel->rd_rel->reltoastrelid))
    9013                 :            :     {
    9014                 :            :         Relation    toastrel;
    9015                 :            : 
    9016                 :          0 :         toastrel = table_open(rel->rd_rel->reltoastrelid, AccessShareLock);
    9017                 :          0 :         FlushRelationBuffers(toastrel);
    9018                 :          0 :         smgrimmedsync(toastrel->rd_smgr, MAIN_FORKNUM);
    9019                 :          0 :         table_close(toastrel, AccessShareLock);
    9020                 :            :     }
    9021                 :            : }
    9022                 :            : 
    9023                 :            : /*
    9024                 :            :  * Mask a heap page before performing consistency checks on it.
    9025                 :            :  */
    9026                 :            : void
    9027                 :          0 : heap_mask(char *pagedata, BlockNumber blkno)
    9028                 :            : {
    9029                 :          0 :     Page        page = (Page) pagedata;
    9030                 :            :     OffsetNumber off;
    9031                 :            : 
    9032                 :          0 :     mask_page_lsn_and_checksum(page);
    9033                 :            : 
    9034                 :          0 :     mask_page_hint_bits(page);
    9035                 :          0 :     mask_unused_space(page);
    9036                 :            : 
    9037 [ #  # ][ #  # ]:          0 :     for (off = 1; off <= PageGetMaxOffsetNumber(page); off++)
    9038                 :            :     {
    9039                 :          0 :         ItemId      iid = PageGetItemId(page, off);
    9040                 :            :         char       *page_item;
    9041                 :            : 
    9042                 :          0 :         page_item = (char *) (page + ItemIdGetOffset(iid));
    9043                 :            : 
    9044         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (ItemIdIsNormal(iid))
    9045                 :            :         {
    9046                 :          0 :             HeapTupleHeader page_htup = (HeapTupleHeader) page_item;
    9047                 :            : 
    9048                 :            :             /*
    9049                 :            :              * If xmin of a tuple is not yet frozen, we should ignore
    9050                 :            :              * differences in hint bits, since they can be set without
    9051                 :            :              * emitting WAL.
    9052                 :            :              */
    9053         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (!HeapTupleHeaderXminFrozen(page_htup))
    9054                 :          0 :                 page_htup->t_infomask &= ~HEAP_XACT_MASK;
    9055                 :            :             else
    9056                 :            :             {
    9057                 :            :                 /* Still we need to mask xmax hint bits. */
    9058                 :          0 :                 page_htup->t_infomask &= ~HEAP_XMAX_INVALID;
    9059                 :          0 :                 page_htup->t_infomask &= ~HEAP_XMAX_COMMITTED;
    9060                 :            :             }
    9061                 :            : 
    9062                 :            :             /*
    9063                 :            :              * During replay, we set Command Id to FirstCommandId. Hence, mask
    9064                 :            :              * it. See heap_xlog_insert() for details.
    9065                 :            :              */
    9066                 :          0 :             page_htup->t_choice.t_heap.t_field3.t_cid = MASK_MARKER;
    9067                 :            : 
    9068                 :            :             /*
    9069                 :            :              * For a speculative tuple, heap_insert() does not set ctid in the
    9070                 :            :              * caller-passed heap tuple itself, leaving the ctid field to
    9071                 :            :              * contain a speculative token value - a per-backend monotonically
    9072                 :            :              * increasing identifier. Besides, it does not WAL-log ctid under
    9073                 :            :              * any circumstances.
    9074                 :            :              *
    9075                 :            :              * During redo, heap_xlog_insert() sets t_ctid to current block
    9076                 :            :              * number and self offset number. It doesn't care about any
    9077                 :            :              * speculative insertions in master. Hence, we set t_ctid to
    9078                 :            :              * current block number and self offset number to ignore any
    9079                 :            :              * inconsistency.
    9080                 :            :              */
    9081         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (HeapTupleHeaderIsSpeculative(page_htup))
    9082                 :          0 :                 ItemPointerSet(&page_htup->t_ctid, blkno, off);
    9083                 :            : 
    9084                 :            :             /*
    9085                 :            :              * NB: Not ignoring ctid changes due to the tuple having moved
    9086                 :            :              * (i.e. HeapTupleHeaderIndicatesMovedPartitions), because that's
    9087                 :            :              * important information that needs to be in-sync between primary
    9088                 :            :              * and standby, and thus is WAL logged.
    9089                 :            :              */
    9090                 :            :         }
    9091                 :            : 
    9092                 :            :         /*
    9093                 :            :          * Ignore any padding bytes after the tuple, when the length of the
    9094                 :            :          * item is not MAXALIGNed.
    9095                 :            :          */
    9096         [ #  # ]:          0 :         if (ItemIdHasStorage(iid))
    9097                 :            :         {
    9098                 :          0 :             int         len = ItemIdGetLength(iid);
    9099                 :          0 :             int         padlen = MAXALIGN(len) - len;
    9100                 :            : 
    9101         [ #  # ]:          0 :             if (padlen > 0)
    9102                 :          0 :                 memset(page_item + len, MASK_MARKER, padlen);
    9103                 :            :         }
    9104                 :            :     }
    9105                 :          0 : }
